The place is currently under new management so I was a little hesitant about this place at first. After ordering the first round, I was pleasantly surprised by how fresh the salmon sashimi was. It was unfortunate however, that when ordering fresh shrimp/scallops (which they are known for), they usually only bring you 30-40% of the quantity amount! Yes I can eat 50 sweet shrimps thank you very much, so I wasn't impressed there.

As for the other parts of the menu, their new "blow torched" sushi had too much rice, the satay skewers were decent, their noodle soup was OK, and their dessert selection is not too exciting. 

Decent sashimi and mediocre everything else.

Cousin introduced me to the jerk chicken here and it was pretty good! Only thing I could see a problem with is lack of parking space during rush hour. Pretty good for take out or quick dine in (but you will leave smelling like jerk chicken lol).

Jerk chicken  was super moist & has a good kick, curry chicken roti was also delicious. I do recommend getting the fried plantains, super yummy!

Beautiful place for brunch. First time I came, there was pasta and prosciutto. This time around was rack of lamb and a waffle station. It was great because we took guests that were in town and ambiance was great. Would definitely come again and recommended for brunch date.

Holy Cannoli! This place is amazing! My bf and I purchased 6 cannolis because....why not? 

What I didn't realize is how addicting they were and ended up finishing all 6 before leaving the shop. They were made to order and flavours were amazing: Oreo, Nutella, raspberry, chocolate/vanilla swirl, pistachio and Sicilian. I loved the pastry shell and the cream was deccadent but not overly sweet.

My boyfriend doesn't like cannolis and ended loving them. We're still thinking about them days later. Absolutely worth the trip to find this place! Would honestly recommend this place and definitely returning soon!!!

Great Sichuan food! Terrible service. Upon entering at 6pm, the male host was very disorganized at taking down numbers for people waiting for seats. Ended up waiting 1/2 hr for seating when he told us it'll be a few minutes.

Food however was very good but I continue to stress how disorganized the staff can be. Our waitress missed a dish completely and decided. Ordered Sesame pancakes (highly recommend), Dan Dan spicy noodles (recommended but super spicy...think: numbing spice) and the grilled beef sizzling plates. All the food was spicy and delicious, so if be prepared for spices...it is Sichuan after all.

Would recommend and would go again, despite quality of service. If you can tolerate that then hope you enjoy the food!!!

Took my friend here for lunch for the first time. We both had the Pork Bone Soup and Bibimbap. Food was great. Only reason why I wouldn't give this a 5 star is simply because it took them 15 mins to give us menus at the beginning. Pricing for food was a touch more expensive compared to other Korean restaurants.

Other than that, definitely a great place in Scarborough.

Great winterlicious experience. Staff was on point and food was amazing. What stood out for me was the ambiance of this restaurant. It is very elegant and posh while dining but does not feel busy even though there was a lot of staff working. Very organized and punctual on food.


Mushroom truffle soup, short ribs and sticky toffee were my favourite and would definitely recommend those!!!

This place was fantastic!!! My fiance and I happened to see this place as we were driving around and it was one of the best impromptu lunch decisions! Our waiter John was so friendly and helpful, everything we ordered was delicious, and we enjoyed ourselves very much :)
Kia always does an amazing job. She is  sweet, friendly and talented. She knows how to get results.  I would definitely recommend her 100%

Sorry I could only give 5 stars this place is really fantastic.  I had the sirloin hash with ailoi sauce and Bleu cheese topped with 2 eggs, the dish was creative and delicious.  My wife had the eggs Benedict and they were heavenly.  Service was awesome.  Chef comes out and greets each table and thanks his guests for coming to his restaurant.  You can't go wrong with this choice.

We took some friends for dinner and really enjoyed the evening. The patio is just perfect with trees and lights. Food was great specially the gnocchi- it was the best I've ever had with delicious flavours. Also loved the Israeli salad - simple and very refreshing with just the right amount of dressing. Our server was courteous and made nice recommendations. Will definitely go again!
Waited a short while for our take out because it was made to order. Smelled great. Substitution allowed on soup with family dinner. Very good. Good deal.

This place is the best, simply put. It is a nice down to earth place ABOUT THE FOOD. They offer steakhouse or sushi. I always come for the sushi.

The sushi is of great quality and friendly prompt service. They don't keep you waiting for your order. All of the apps are delicious including fried soft shell crab, fried scallops, screem inor gazim. The sashimi is part of all you can eat  as well as kama, cajun tuna and smoked salmon nigiri. Great cocktail, beer and drink selection. Nice desserts. 

Open for dinner only. Ladies discounted dinner after 11PM

I like to try new sushi restaurants every so often but, this is home.
Great experience! Everyone is super friendly with fast service. Neat and clean inside. Awesome menu options, hearty servings at a great price!

Do not come here for the service. They did not bring out my complete order, which was a small appetizer plate. It took them half an hour to bring it back out to me. No apology whatsoever, no offer to make it right.

First official pedicure since I had my son, 4 months ago!!! This is the time that works best and it's been difficult to accommodate, Sunday at 5:30PM.. I found and recommend this nail salon. Open 7 days a week until 10/11PM!! Nice atmosphere, very eager to please, quality work. Busy, call ahead.

(Dined 2-14-2013, thought I already posted) 
My husband and I just finished our "Valentines Day" dinner tonight,  Saturday evening. He was very excited about the surprise dinner he planned stating they had great reviews and is always listed as a top Steakhouse. Neither of us had dined here before. 

We arrived to The Steakhouse after walking through The Circus Circus to find a surprising setting and ambiance. We were greeted by the manager and immediately walked to our booth after giving our reservation info. The manager actually turned the table sideways so I could slide in and moved it back after we sat! Being 6 months pregnant I found it unexpected and greatly appreciated. 


The menu was old school, straight forward and genuine. We both ordered the bone-in prime rib. It was a Flintstones sized cut! Delicious. For dessert we got 2 orders of the chocolate covered strawberries because the first was so sweet.

But, the kicker, the icing on the cake, what really made the entire evening special, unique and tailored to us was Javier's top notch attention and service!! He was friendly, pleasant and engaging. He spoke to us about our soon to be baby girl being that it was our first child and told us about his family and related. He was absolutely amazing and definitely made the evening memorable. My husband and I enjoyed our first Valentines as a married couple because of the experience at The Steakhouse!
Fun, upbeat atmosphere. Great service. They offer free samples of every flavor... The gelato tastes fresh and pure. We were not dissapointed on our first visit and we will be back!

I am NOT familiar w/ what might be considered "real" Cajun food.  I had the Cajun Trio meal of jambalaya; sausage & chicken gumbo; and crawfish pie.  The pie could have had less pastry and more meat and fillings.  The jambalaya was primarily a combination of rice and chicken, missing what I was expecting to be a significant amount of red sauce of some kind.  I combined the jambalaya and the gumbo to create a satisfying mélange more closely resembling what I expected jambalaya to be.  The meal was flavorful, not overpowering, and the portions were more than sufficient.  The service was prompt and friendly.  The atmosphere is lacking, unfortunately consistent w/ the strip-mall location (I had hoped for more of a "Pappadeaux's"-type feel), but the canned Cajun music (CD I assume) was appropriate and enjoyable.  Overall, not QUITE deserving of 4 stars, but significantly better than 3 stars.  If I ever return to the area, I would eat here again.

I had a good burger and salad here, though I have been to a number of Culver's many times (mostly in Milwaukee area), and Culver's food can be somewhat inconsistent compared to other national fast food chains. Excellent and friendly service, which I experience at every location.  And of course the frozen custard is great.

I don't eat a lot of italian food because I'm afraid of all the regrets I'll have when I step on the scale next day, but wow. This place is amazing. It has an amazing atmosphere and really nice staff. We ordered takeout but one of the orders was mixed up and they were extremely courteous and prompt in fixing everything. The food is incredible! DEFINITELY GET A PIZOOKIE.

Wow, I've never had the problems as a previous reviewer and I've eaten here for the past 4 years. It's been so long that I know the owners and they are really friendly people! Place is packed for lunch when schools have half days though so watch out for that!

Service was great. Ambiance was great. Bbq chicken was tremendous. Don't recommend the salmon (very basic, came undercooked). Coconut cake is a must have. I just can't give 5 stars because I was let down with the entrees overall. Simplistic dishes.

Good food. Good service. New to the area so the staff is still going through growing pains but an awesome job overall. The only downfall to this place is parking. Absolutely horrible. You need to park away from the restaraunt in Basha's lot or over near Starbucks.
Excellent!!!! The owner is extremely friendly and engaged with his customers. The cinnamon roll was off the charts! Food is fantastic. Highly recommend this restaurant.

I love this pizza. I'm from a pizza city, and in my opinion there are too many crappy pizza places in the valley. This is traditional European pizza just like what you get in France and Italy. I love the simple tomato sauce, and the fresh topping. Absolutely delicious.

My main location is the one on horizon ridge, but I come here sometimes. It's consistently excellent for this style of mex, order at the counter - workn man's grub IMO. Definitely a staple. Best salsa anywhere. I usually get breakfast burritos.

My favorite Thai restaurant in the valley. Personal service, great fresh food. I love the red curry beef, the pad Thai, pad seeyu, all the soups, and the best orange chicken in the world. They are very family friendly. My kids are treated with respect and care.

I've driven by this place a million times, but never stopped. It's tucked away in a modest strip mall, somewhat of a hidden gem. I strolled in on a whim, and ordered the filet mignon souvlaki dinner. It was incredible. The steak was perfect, and the salad was fresh and delicious. Nice large portion, and I had a huge baklava for desert, which was perfect. Great place, and very good service. Good value. I will definitely be back
The service here is extraordinary - over the top. I stay here regularly. They really make an effort to satisfy guests.

My preferred Thai place was closed, and I used to come here so I tried it. Great lunch specials, very good value. Soup, egg roll, salad, orange slices, rice, and entree. The fried rice is great. Pad see-ew, pad Thai, green curry, all very good. Again, very good lunch value.

Upstairs has the best whisk(e)y selection you could ever imagine. World class. Downstairs same but beer. Guy behind the bar grills up wicked bar grub. Bartenders are good conversation. Some nights they have a movie playing. Never know what's up there, but it's a legend in my book.
Rubios has really good food in general, and this is a great location. Excellent service always! I love the grilled mahi tacos. I go often and always enjoy it.

This is a nice clean Mexican grill. One of the best in the city. I'm a sucker for these places, and in this area, this is the best spot I've found.

Excellent food and service, and good prices.

I'm impressed with the quality of meat here. They have beef tenderloin as an option. We had the filtel mignon with onions entre as well as the pho filet mignon. Both were excellent. Good service, and fair prices. Very good food

Eco tint provides amazing products and service. I have taken 3 vehicles here for tint. I will be taking another in the next few weeks. I am sure there are other good tint shops in town, but this is the one I love. They are across the valley from me. The drive is worth the experience.  Tell Sue that Keith sent you.  She is a character and joy to chat with. 


When choosing your tint, just pay the small difference for the ceramic. It provides an amazing heat barrier. I also highly recommend the AIR 80 on the front windshield.  The day I drove my Vette there my arm was burning from the sun coming through the window and the A/C was blasting. As I drive away the car was considerably cooler and the A/C was whisper quite.  Because of the front tint I no longer use the indash sunshade for short stops. The front tint is crystal clear and It block out most of the heat.  The AIR 80 does not have any color to it and is not noticeable, but provides great heat protection.

Called Tire Mart on short notice for an upcoming trip. I needed trailer tires bad. Claudia answered the phone and told me all my options. They did not have the full quantity in stock, but they sent a driver to the warehouse to grab the extra ones.  I arrived the next day at 9am.  They had me in and out in no time.  

Ceasar showed me a few other tire options for my truck. He is super knowledgeable and explained the different options available. They have several product lines from cheap to high quality.  

I go through a ton of tires. I have been shopping Discount Tire for years.  I think I have found a new tire store.


I highly recommended you give them a chance.

So let me start this with, I hate used car dealers and rarely ever consider them for my buying options.

Marty had a car I was interested in and I met with him to take a look.  Marty is super awesome and openly communicated the facts he knew about the car.  The entire buying experience was amazing.  He even delivered the car because I could not get a ride to his dealership once the paperwork was complete.  He explained the entire process and always picked up the phone if I had any questions.  If you want a particular vehicle, let Marty know and he will find it for you.  Thanks for everything Marty.  I would give 10 stars if I could

Place is delicious. Lucky to have found this restuarant. Wil be visiting again soon. Will also be our go to restaurant for visiting guest. 

Great atmosphere. Try the lasagna and save room for the Creme Bulle. 

Tell Johnny, the guy at the door, Keith said hello.

You need to come to Austin Tx. Nothing like this there. Fastest growing big city in U.S. Still lots of hippies.
Sheldon

It was an absolute pleasure doing business with Lou at Vespa Toronto West. Straight ahead information, no sales pleasure, friendly and informative. It's clear Lou knows he's selling a good product and he wants you to enjoy it. I can't recommend Lou and his service and store highly enough. He gave us sound advice, kept us informed and even delivered our bikes to us in Ottawa. If only all sales encounters were like this the world would be a happier place. Bravo Lou!

This was not my first time at Encore, I'm a regular here, the best hotel to stay in Vegas, no comparison.
This time, I was there for our anniversary, and  I just want to thank Joyce  at front desk, she is a sweet heart!
With her great customer service level, she checked us in and surprised us by sending a beautiful card along with chocolates to our room later!
Thank you Joyce and thank you Encore for having the best staff.
Five stars all the way.
I love this store they have such awesome dresses !!!! Got my dress for a fashion event earlier this year at this store and had a lot of people asking me where I got it from.

If you are an intellectual, you will love this place. You can sit it in your hotel room, far away from the Strip, and ponder whether it is a good business decision for the Rio to sell overpriced food at their restaurants. Doesn't that just remind people how far away they are from the cheaper food on the Strip? Should they be using the Madison Square Garden concession model when they don't have the Knicks? Then you can stare at your bathroom door and wonder why an outfit which runs and expensive Mardi Gras sky show can't paint the door and replace the broken door stop. You will have a lot of time to think, because after the Penn and Teller show, there is nothing else to do.

If you love banh mi boyz, then you may have a hard time giving this place a chance. But, the 2 sandwiches ice tried were quite good. 

1. Lemongrass chicken banh mi: flavours were good, and the baguette was nice and toasty. 

2. Tofu and oyster mushroom bao: I loved the flavours for this one. Texture was lacking thought because everything was 'mushy' (the good kind)

I love banh mi boyz' made to order freshness. This is like the "Subway Sandwiches" version of that.  $7.50 a sandwich won't break the bank, and it's a nice option at Yorkdale. Give it try.
Edward is amazing, I cannot imagine getting my insurance from anyone else. He really took the time to answer all of our insurance questions. Thanks Edward!!
Karly is an absolute wonderful photographer, I'm so glad we chose her for our newborn daughter pictures.  I would highly recommend her to anyone.

We have been here for so many times. Their foods are good, service not bad. But this time is very awful because of the owner. We ordered salmon sashimi at the third time, the owner(manager) told us they had not enough salmon to provide. Are you kidding me? AYCE sushi store had not enough to be ordered!!! Another ridiculous thing is the owner said next time if you came to our store for these much order (75 pieces salmon sashimi for 5 people), need to ask first if they could provide before having dinner here. We felt very upset for we couldn't order what we liked to eat, then I paid AYCE. We won't go back.

I am a preferred member with Avis, who I normally rent from.  This one week in November, for some reason every other rental agency was sold out.  I rented for 2 days with Advantage - OK experience at the check-out and check-in.  A few days later - I am told there is a damage claim on my vehicle for tire damage, and I need to settle with my insurance company or Credit Card.  I am told that I signed a paper affirming the damage to the vehicle while returning - total baloney!   Has this happened to others also who have rented from Advantage @CLT?   I'd like to know if this is a common malpractice that they normally engage in.   My credit card covers me end-to-end, so money is not the issue, but as a matter of principle, I don't want people being taken advantage of - especially with false claims.
The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. The free breakfast was good, but show up early. Ample free parking. I'd stay here again. Not fancy, but nice.

Our air conditioning went out on Saturday late afternoon.  I called and left a message and Mike called back within 10 minutes.  He talked me thru several things to try and get it back on but nothing worked so he called Eric for a emergency trip out.  Eric arrived within 30 minutes and was able to get it back on in a short amount of time.
As always everyone at AHR was very professional and helpful.
Thank you AHR
Excellent  food; full of flavor. Everything on the menu is great. Service  is great. Great place for any occasion.
Great customer service, my hair dresser was amazing! She did exactly what I asked for!  Definitely going back!

I wanted a specific watch band and buckle. Evon, at Minh Chau, spent a good amount of time with me finding the solution to my needs. Her quiet and thoughtful manner, without any kind of pressure, was most appreciated. I highly recommend this family store for your consideration.  Ron D
Good food, fresh items on the Buffet. Small Sushi selection,  Hibachi, soups, salads, and deserts. Good for at a great price!

Best bartenders and management in town! Definitely stop in and visit here! Never an empty drink and they always take care of players. I always go here instead of the other dozen local dives that give borderline service at best... drink here first!

The food menu is great as well, try the garlic fries. Also breakfast is great! Excellent wait staff as well..we're big fans!

This location is filthy! The sneeze guard had spit and whatever on it right at eye level...yuck! The employees are rude and pushy, it wasn't even busy. The whole restaurant was dirty and when I went to get a soda, the machine had fruit flies flying around the ice tray. The health department should definitely give this place a visit!

Service is prompt and precise! We've been to this location twice and have been over satisfied if that is possible. Price is very reasonable and the food was excellent. We will definitely return again. Highly recommended for lunch!

Other than the dining room itself being filthy & the sticky menus on the tables the carnitas fries were very delightful. The hot dogs were unique and filling but not very tasty.
This was our first and only visit here since it has been opened and we are on the fence about returning. It was ok..

We eat here once every 3 months since the new owners took over and generally it's decent food and service. This time, 2 out of the 4 items we ordered had a single hair on it. It sounds cliche, but it happened...

We were disappointed and discussed, so much that I signed up for a yelp account just to vent. I'm not sure if we'll return and give them another shot..there is a pizza shop on every corner!

*owner said they are implementing new protocol and offered to make things right with us..we are definitely not looking for a free meal, just a good pie! 

We shall visit again in the near future  and give them another shot.

We visited for my son's UNLV visit and enjoyed the hotel for the price. Clean rooms, nice pool with comfortable couches and chairs, and a good location next to Fremont Street. Free covered garage parking located across the street was very convenient. The wi-fi worked perfectly.

Brisket is PERFECT! Tender, tasty and ample portions. We had leftovers for 3 days. I serving could easily serve 2 people. The collard greens, baked beans and rolls were good too. The chicken is flavorful and moist to the bone, and the rib tips were flavored perfectly with an excellent chew. The male employees were cute too.

After a near disaster with an inexperienced plumber who was going to charge us $350.00 to install our new R/O system, we sent out for a quote on the internet to have a Reverse Osmosis system installed .   The only company to respond was Rain Water Conditioning.   They quoted us less than half of what the other plumber quoted for the install, and we set it up for the next day.   Doug was our installer.   He was prompt, pleasant, extremely experienced, and got the install done in under an hour.   I was so happy with his work that I asked about the Rain water conditioning systems and he gave us prices.   I will definitely be using them in the future for a new water conditioning system.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY.

Everything about this window treatment company is excellent.  We just moved into a house and needed blackout cellular shades for the bedrooms.   I had two other estimates before I found Day and Night Blinds.  Chuck's price was the best, his service was the best, and the product was the best!  I cannot say enough good things about this experience.   Also, Chuck is very pleasant to work with, always a big smile, and he definitely will go the extra mile to satisfy his customer.   HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

We were moving out of a rental house and needed to have the carpets cleaned.  Carpet was only in two bedrooms, one large, one small.   In the mail, we found a coupon for carpet cleaning from Green Carpet Cleaning for four rooms for $59.00.  We set up an appointment for a technician to clean the two rooms.   As soon as he got there, he started to upsell.   His first price to "really" clean this carpet was a whopping $179.00!  My husband said NO.   He then called his "boss" who said he could do it for $159.00.   Again, my husband said no, this was just a rental and we were not going to pay that kind of price for carpet cleaning.  I was not there at the time, but it I had been, I would have told him to leave and gotten someone else.   My husband made him stick to the $59.00 price.   What you get for $59.00 for two rooms from this company is steam cleaning and nothing else.  He would not use shampoo or any of the "eco" products they advertise.  Just plain water steam.   When he was finished, there were still indents in the carpet from the beds that had been there.   He was asked to rake the carpet up and the technician told him that would be an additional charge.   So my husband had to do it himself.  The technician also stated that carpet cleaning is now "a la carte".   Everything is extra.   So if you want to use this company, be prepared to pay and pay and pay.

This is the second time my husband and I have used Joel to install a fireplace for us.   The first time (5 years ago), he installed the fireplace when only my husband was home.   When I got home later, the fireplace had been installed too high.   Joel came back and put it exactly where I wanted it and never charged us extra!   So when we recently bought another house, we wanted the new linear crystal fireplace installed instead of the old square kind that the house had.  We called around and could get no one to even give us a quote.   I called up the company Joel had worked for when he did our fireplace 5 years ago but he wasn't working there any longer.   I googled his name to find he has his own company now.   So we called him and he installed our new fireplace beautifully.   Very exacting workmanship.   I definitely recommend him.

Prompt.  Friendly staff and service persons.  
Called me to advise when he would arrive.  Reasonable and seemed honest price without the up-sale. Was bracing for a weekend service visit charge but was quite pleased with my service.
Recommended by my earlier home warranty coverage and was impressed by their work that I hired them again and will in the future.

One of the more honest business that I trust to do work on my many a/c issues.

Great healthy food and great people who run the place.  Regular customer and never disappointed.  
Salads even great without dressing.  
You should try it!

Best around.  Salsa great!  Beans and rice, the basis of Mexican food was perfect.  My combination plate was savory, spicy and kept me wanting more.  After years of eating at the other local Mexican restaurants, this is the one the competition should worry about!

Lack of Detail car wash
I went for the 49.99 hand wax detail.   Brought in a $15 coupon for 49.99 or more detail.  Could not use it as $11 dollars were for the wash and wax(detail) was $38.  

Watched them wipe on and off a wax solution haphazardly for 5 minutes then stand around talking.  I was as if they were spreading sunscreen on the car, not waxing it proper.  Wow,  $38 for that with some wax and dirt still on the car.  

I suggest you get the cheapest wash then do the rest yourself. I spent 30 minute detailing my car after.  I got out the tar, bug, and dirt marks with easy and within seconds.  

Never again.  
I did the interior previously, so they did not touch the inside.  A previous experience was just as bad.   The carpets were soaked/drenched in solution.  Left the carpets crusty.  

My bad for this second "detail" chance.  Again just stick with the cheap wash and you should be content with that.
Awesome pizza.  Perfect every time.  Addicted to the magical mystery pizza.  Beer selection great as well.  Service kind and attentive.  My goto spot for great pizza.   Salads average.

It was fun and relaxing. Reminded me of a bigger version on the franklin conservatory.  Fun for kids and adults a like. Good for a field trip or maybe a fun date with the SO. Would def recommend to see if you get a chance. Some of the outdoor views were really fun to experience.

The reviews matched my experience. The pad Thai was ok. Nothing special. Can't say I would go back but I also would scare someone away. Don't have a lot to say other than it was just ok.  Maybe I'll give it a chance and try something else.
The food was pretty darn good.  The service was awesome.  Would recommend for big groups. We had a lot left over. Very open Family style food.
Didn't get a chance to even eat. We just left there moments ago. Both hostess were really rude for no apparent reason. Gave them a chance to correct politely. No luck.

Was not too bad for a bar type atmosphere.  I tried the deviled eggs. Delicious. Also tried the chipotle style pizza and it was pretty good. I'd recommend the place for some American style food for before or after a night out. Staff was really friendly and accommodating.
Ok ok I could have fed an entire college dorm Ramen for how much I paid for mine. With that said it was worth every penny. Service was awesome too.  You could tell the chef had a lot of respect.
The burger was perfect and the flavor best in class.  It was fun watching the staff work together as I sat at the bar.  Well worth the Gordon Ramsey name on the door.
Four Peaks is one of my favorite places to go in AZ. The food is unbeatable as far as bar food is concerned if you ask me. Try the French Dip with a side salad. The best ever!

Hands down some of the best cake bites I've ever eaten, and oooooh lordy were the cookies good too! Also,  side note.... great treat for house warming gift,  party snacks or suck up to a teacher your kid pissed off. Great service,  super friendly staff and fun environment for the kids! Highly recommend!

We live in the neighborhood and can walk here. We noticed the "Wine Down Wednesdays" and made a note to definitely check it out. You would think with the bustling atmosphere of Hitchhiker across the street, this place would take more of an advantage of their location. However, upon arriving at 920pm on Wednesday, we walked in the door and were told "They were closed". Lights were on, staff was there. It was really bizarre. I ate here once before and it's not that special to begin with especially when considering the other options in the area, however, this incident put the nail in the coffin for me. Here's a recommendation: Don't specifically advertise a special for Wednesday nights then close 40 minutes before your posted business hours.

Great place for delicious steak in a low key atmosphere. Also had salad and roasted vegetables which I also enjoyed. Aside from generally being a tasty choice, if your dietary persuasion is of the paleo/keto variety, this place should be 1-A on the list.
Menu is not extensive but the food is really well prepared for what they offer. The actual Arancini is incredible.
This place stands out among the burgeoning gastropub scene. I know beer and this beer is well executed. The above average farm to table style menu is also a big plus. Prices are also reasonable.

I've been to Bigham over 50 times as it is in my neighborhood. I've never had a bad experience there. The food is always great and they offer an impressive craft beer selection. The wings are easily amongst the best in the city. I highly recommend jackal and cluckin hot sauces for fans of the heat.

This establishment is a great option for craft beers and meatballs. The ambience is interesting and service is always great. They offer several types of meatballs served over a variety of options. I've had most of them and have never had a bad experience.

Hands down best Thai in the city. They also know how to spice it up authentically. I've had a variety of options off the menu and have always been impressed. Also, this place is a sneaky great pick to go to pre-pirates or steelers as it is conveniently located a few blocks from the north shore.

Had brunch twice. Great experience both times. Very talented staff. I ordered the chicken and waffles both times and it was delicious. The Bloody Mary bar is also fun and impressive. The ambience is also very inviting and relaxing.

I've been to La Casa Rasta twice. Both times I've had the jerk chicken burrito. It is one of my favorite choices in the mex/Caribbean genre. What distinguishes la casa Rasta from its peers is the freshness and unique flavor to the food. I also recommend the queso dip, guacamole, and plantains. The service has also always been exceptional.

It is fairly remarkable that with all the other better options available in the Pittsburgh market serving Italian/bar food that this place actually exists. While the ambience initially suggests otherwise,  the overall experience was disappointing. Along with some of the other reviews, my service experience was lacking. The pizza was freezer quality. Along with the parking hassle, you'd be better off just about anywhere else. I rarely take the time to review unless the experience is exceptional one way or the other, and this place would qualify unfortunately as the other. Don't waste your time or money.

Full disclosure: I was an early adopter in the Kickstarter campaign and came in with high expectations. Those expectations were delivered upon this evening. Also in attendance with me was my 4 year old son, so I will give you his review as well. First off, the wait staff and Chris in management were completely gracious and accommodating in having plain pasta prepared for my son immediately which he devoured. The adults enjoyed the salad, Octopus and rice cake appetizers. I'm reading a lot about portions in the reviews and while they were certainly not huge, they weren't unreasonably small. My son said the salad tasted like soap but continued eating anyway. I didn't quite come away with that that mouthfeel and thought it was fine, maybe slightly unremarkable. The octopus and rice cakes really took the prize. Not sure what was going on with either of them but they were gone in about five minutes. We had the hangar steak and chicken entrees. These were nothing short of spectacular and the steak was borderline art. Expertly prepared in every aspect. We all shared the chocolate and pastry dessert and were very pleased with both. We will be returning regularly and I can't say enough about the service and overall atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Church Brew Works is one of my favorite destinations in Pittsburgh. Easily 5 stars for ambience as the repurposed church is gorgeous and offers several interesting seating locations. The beer is excellent and should please both craft lovers and casual beer drinkers. What I admire most is that CBW could probably get by with mediocre food because of the location and beer alone, but the food is also incredible. I've had variations of a cheesesteak several times and have always been impressed. They also have great salad and pizza options too!

I've been to Eleven a few times and it has consistently been a great experience. My last meal was the lamb chops. They were excellent and prepared perfectly. I highly recommend eleven for a date or small group.
I've been here a few times. The sushi and service are always pretty good. The spicy special rolls are among the best in the city.

Totopo is currently my favorite Mexican restaurant in Pittsburgh. Ive had the majority of the menu and haven't had anything that wasn't exceptional. Many Mexican restaurants are heavy on the cheese and oil but Totopo is always fresh and light while having generous portions. They have awesome margaritas as well and I enjoy the regular weeknight specials.

Went there at 2 AM expecting the kitchen to be closed but was greeted with 5$ specials from 12-3 instead. Got BBQ wings (part of the 5$ happy hour) and a double double burger. Loved them both, and the bartender and cook were both friendly. Can't beat 5$ wings and a 10$ burger as a midnight meal! Definitely going all the time since they're right down the street from me.
Pretty good place if you're looking for a cheap Mexican food place, I always get the breakfast burrito with bacon and it's pretty quick (5-10 minutes) every time.
Went there the first day and had our food when we got done paying, literally. Great service and great restaurant chain.
Nothing to complain about, not amazing but pretty good especially for the price. Good place to get some teriyaki or other types of Asian style food.
Probably one of the best nail spots ive been to their work is very neat and my nails always looking nice and clean I love their work and their prices are affordable.

So let me start off by saying this is the most accommodating office I have ever been to, I decided to come in as a walk-in since I was in the area, the front desk was very helpful and did not have a problem by fitting me into their schedule. The office atmosphere was very pleasant and simply very kind and friendly the assistant was very professional when it came to listening to my concerns and why I was in the office for, last but not least Dr. Barbosa is very professional and he did not made me feel like he was in a rush to move on to his next patient like I've experience in other offices, overall I highly recommend coming in to Healthy Smiles. Best dentist hands down in Las Vegas.
Id give them a higher star rate if they would be a little cleaner inside and out, other than that i definitely love the asada fries I always go for them.

I was recently at PT's off of Durango, which is two minutes away from my house and is my go to spot. I have came to this location for a couple years now and I usually have a good experience. Today, my bartender was Jen and I must say, you'd think if you were in the customer service industry, you'd actually provide good customer service. She did not provide anything but a horrible attitude. First of all, when I came in, my friend and I could barely sit down before she demanded my ID. After she spent a minute or so looking over it, she got my drink and slammed it on the bar. She didn't provide me with a beverage napkin or anything of sorts. It took me ten minutes to ask her for a water because I'm going to assume I'm a female and I'm not gambling. I watched her talk to every GUY at the bar and ignored me. I have been a cocktail waitress and a bartender for over 7 years and I know there is someone who would love to have her job. She needs to be re-trained to accommodate her customers. I'm sick and tired of seeing Waitresses/Bartenders be a complete asshole for no reason. You have one job. Do it right or find another one. I will not be coming back here when Jen is working ever again.

Truly a dining experience! Some of the best ambiance and decor and the food and drinks are delicious. Loved all of the 4 courses and the attention to detail. If you are in the area this is definitely a memory to make--request the back patio.
Love the mimosa flight and the various "hash" options--one of our favorite breakfast spots. If you come on a Saturday be prepared for a little wait. :)

This is a great company. They're reliable, honest and the owner is a man of his word. During the move I had a bed that was damaged, however the owner promptly took care of the problem, with no cost to me. I would definitely recommend this company to others. Guaranteed A+ service.
Best music, great staff, staple in the North Shore for Baseball/football games ! All around fun atmosphere !

Amazing - great atmosphere and food. Love the BYOB. The food is well done. Their staff could be a little nicer. Sometimes when we call to ask about how long the wait is they aren't always nice over the phone. Happy with the food though.

What a wonderful experience this dinner was. It has a very romantic atmosphere and the establishment is really charming. The hand crafted cocktails were delicious and well made. The dinner was absolutely delicious. Overall wonderful low key with high quality. Great execution.

Our dogs do well there - however it does scare me that these reports of them not giving dogs enough water and food is scary since we will be boarding our dogs for 2 weeks there due to our wedding and honeymoon. We actually had not 1 uber but 2 uber drivers tell us that their dogs were dehydrated after leaving. I noticed my dog was very skinny and super thirsty after picking them up. The one Uber driver told us that his friend use to work there and they would limit their water use to lessen the indoor clean up. I also wish they had a web cam due to all the horror stories now a days with groomers and boarders. This works perfect for us bc our dog is very large and demands a lot of care and I also have a small dog that has terrible separation anxiety. We are thinking about doing a few more test runs with this place before we decide to board for the long two week period. We love that they post photos of our dogs, but with the technology today they should absolutely have a webcam site.
Great atmosphere. Great menu. Great cocktails. Great service. Ordered the flank steak and it was delicious. Had a very wonderful time.

Very rough - the guy hurt my neck and I had black and blue marks on my shoulder and mid upper back. It was very painful for 5 days after and a spot in my neck hasn't healed. I have a hard time tilting my head backwards. The place is un organized and I have had awful headaches ever since. I'm very scared that whatever injury I sustained here will stick around. I have never had constant headaches and neck pain like I do now. It's worth researching before you just go here.

Two is gracious 

1. The service is bland - no personality 
- waited 10 to 15 for our drinks 
- placed app order - they were out of that specific app 
- ordered muscles, took one bite and had to use my napkin to spit it out. Fishy and gritty - told the server we were unhappy and he just said ok, so you are finished with these ? Yes, because they are bad.
- had to ask for plates and forks to attempt to eat these monstrosities. 
- ordered dinner - dinner arrived, had to ask for forks again 
-$72.00 later when we finally got the check - we put $100 in cash down and he asked  if we needed change. Yes, because we are not leaving you a $28 tip for ok service ... 
- pizza was good 

Peeps - don't waste your time on this place...

This place is good. The style from the outside doesn't really portray what is on the inside. Our waitress was great! Burgers were good. The atmosphere Is a little dated. Menu was limited. Over all it was a good burger and great staff.
Complete a**hole on the phone. Don't waste your time - what a joke. Called about lawn service got one word answers and basically told me he didn't want the job.

FANTASTIC. The atmosphere and the food are wonderful. When I say the service was slow I don't mean it in a bad way. It gives you time to have a drink and appetizer while looking over the menu, what I mean is I didn't feel rushed.  The burger I had was the Apple & Goat Cheese. I just moved to the North Side and I will visit this place again and again !
Amazing ... Food was great. Prices are great... Portions are perfect... Loved the simplicity of the menu. Do about 20 items perfectly rather than 50 terribly.. They nailed it... We loved our meals.

Overall from my experience at Surrender I would rate it 4 stars. It is a very spacious nightclub located at Encore. They have a big open bar area and pool setup which makes the view at night very nice. I like how it is an indoor/outdoor club but I recommend to everyone to chip in and go with the cabanas so you will have a place to sit, relax and enjoy your night here.

I recommend this spot as a pregame spot rather than an all night stay. It all depends on your preference but Hyde is moreso an ultra lounge rather than a nightclub. As noted by many other reviews, one of the best parts about this place is the overview of the Fountains of Bellagio and in the background, the Eiffel Tower at Paris. When it turns into a nightclub the music is more techno. Overall not bad a bad spot but not something I would spend my entire night at. 3 stars.

Tao is a very energetic nightclub located within the Venetian. They offer you 3 rooms to chose from depending on your preference of music. The bigger room upstairs offers the best expiereince in the club. The smaller room upstairs is a bit overcrowded and you dont get the whole Tao experience. The room downstairs plays hip hop but is usually not as busy and live as any of the other rooms. Overall the decor looks great inside. My overall experience is that Thursday night (Tao Industry Night) is your best bet to enjoy the night and have a good time.

I arrived at Jogoya at around 8pm after coming out of the Harkins Theatres across the street. When I saw that the buffet closed at 9pm, I was hesitant to have dinner there lest the entree items would not be restocked once empty. However, my friends and I were in the mood for seafood, and we were pleasantly surprised that the employees continued to replenish the buffet items despite coming near closing time. The foods consisted of typical American-Chinese buffet dishes as well as some unique ones that pointed towards traditional Chinese style foods. Although the price is a bit higher than other American-Chinese buffets, Jogoya matches its seafood-buffet competitors in fresh and tasty sushi, sashimi, and other seafood dishes. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to parties large and small looking for a place to eat.
Great experience while watching Avengers: Age of Ultron. Great sound and picture quality. Concession stand also had friendly and fast service.
Great, fast, and friendly service. I don't normally get this kind of luxury food, but my friend's recommendation was well received. Great place to cool down after a day of work or exercise.

I waited to post this after my 3rd treatment because I really couldn't believe the results. The treatment was the most comfortable I've had. The aftermath was the most promising as I had several treatments at a doctors office and was left with welts for a week plus. Not here! I've seen a significant reduction in hair and the pricing / technology is the best in town. Highly recommend. Ask for Anahit, she is extremely knowledgable and very professional.

I'm giving it one star because I do not have the option to give no stars. I found this salon on google using my zip code "89148". When I called I specified I would need two manicure pedicures and one separate pedicure. The women who answered was friendly and outgoing and answered all of my questions with perfect answers. I expected it would be a great experience. It was the exact opposite. Without having to write a novel, the woman doing my nails hands were shaking and clearly she was in a rush. I have "gel polish," which I specified during the phone call, which was being removed with some type of acetone foil wrap. This of course takes place without asking me first. I do ask "what are you doing?"  The response far from clear. I explain I'm not familiar with the process she's using but allow her to take control. Once she finished removing the foils she began filing. My nails were crooked and still had a thick layer of the gel she attempted to remove. She asks "how do they look? Go ahead and wash your hands so we can paint". I responded "they are crooked and have a thick layer of gel that wasn't removed". She tosses the file on the small table and tells me to go ahead and "fix". She then walks away! I find myself filing my own nails for 5 minutes. I'm not sure if I was more shocked or furious. The rest is history... The owner, I assume, must have a steady flow of regulars that keep her busy as she didn't care and even began to raise her voice claiming I  should have explained more?! More?! What more do I need to say. Lol. Unprofessional. Unbelievable... To top it off my moms manicure tech cut her toe, she too was also rushing... To go home
I have eaten here a couple times. Very good pizza and service. The wood top tables were also pretty cool and added to the overall feel of the place.

Still the best steakhouse in Charlotte. 

Great service, great food, great ambiance. There are other good steakhouses in the area but with the closest competition (Mcintosh) closed, this is the best in Charlotte.

I have never had a bad meal here. It is consistently excellent. The strip, filet , lobster, etc. -all good.

I am a bit of a pizza snob and this area is littered with pizza places, most of whom are nothing worth writing about. This pizza, however, is excellent.

The sauce is rich without being overpowering.
I have had two pizzas here and the crust on both was delicious and cooked perfectly.
The cheese and toppings were well balanced and fresh.
Not too greasy but enough for you to appreciate it :-)

After hearing good things my wife and I stopped in yesterday. The salsa and chips were better than most American Mexican places. The shrimp tacos were excellent. Good flavor, nice balance of heat and flavor. 

Service was attentive and yet not bothersome. Pricing was a little higher than some other places but was competitive for what you get in terms of portions and flavor. Definitely will be back.

I stopped here with a colleague from work as we were coming into town for a meeting and were looking for a local place where we could get something different.

The staff was friendly and did a good job keeping up with everything and making sure we had whatever we needed.

The food was good (we had roast beef and baba), not life changing good, but a decent local place sort of good. 

The music was a bit too loud for us to continue our conversation after eating (the speaker was right over our heads) so we did not stick around as long as we might have otherwise. 

Overall not too bad

I have eaten here 4 or 5 times when in town. The food and service are always very good and I have never had a bad meal here. The steak is always cooked perfectly and has good flavor. The mac and cheese and various vegetable sides are always good. The potatoes can be salty at times but still decent.

The atmosphere is pretty good although the dining room is a bit crowded at times. The service has been attentive and pleasant each time without having the kind of snobbishness you sometimes encounter at a good steakhouse. They have been genuinely fun and helpful every time.

I have had better steaks but Sullivan's has been consistently very good and I would recommend it to anyone looking for steak in Charlotte.

I have had a lot of bad BBQ. This was not bad, but it wasn't great either. 

I had the "pick 4" sampler. The ribs were a bit tough and not as juicy as I would have expected. They had decent smokey flavor and the BBQ sauces were good but altogether they were average. The brisket was unremarkable, pretty much what you get most chain type places. The pulled pork was better than average but not by much. Of all the meats I tried the sausage was the best in comparison to what I have had elsewhere. It had good flavor and just the right amount of heat.

As for the sides... The mac and cheese was just ok, I wasn't impressed by the beans, the grilled corn was alright but nothing special. The highlight was actually the corn bread. The bread is made into little corn bread muffins which were absolutely excellent.

I should say that the service was excellent and helped to make the overall experience A-OK instead of just ok.

Overall I would say it is a typical family friendly chain that might serve the purpose if you are hungry but is not a must visit when in the area.

Perhaps my viewpoint is based on the Le Reve days when it was very dangerous (some deaths I have read sadly) but that was my last Vegas show a couple years ago. We chose "O" because it was rated 'kid friendly' and while it was weirdly dark it was fine. Never understood what looks like a half eaten body hanging on the stage, which was disturbing and had no purpose. There are some amazing trapeze artists and incredible diving action at the end but both my 12 year old and I actually snoozed a little bit. It was fine, but it wasn't amazing and I'm used to Vegas shows being pretty amazing. For the money, it needs to be amazing.
What a great atmosphere! Fun and cozy at the same time! Great staff, very helpful, beers suggested were wonderful.

50 people show up for a pre-arranged happy hour at 3pm today and these idiots make them sit outside in the sun when it's 107 and humid? Way to make a great first impression folks. Major fail. Never trust them with a group or expect them to provide real service.
Great authentic Thai and Viet-Chinese. Friendly, neat decor and reasonably priced. Huge portions and lots of fresh herbs. A winner.

I've eaten here before with good results but tonight the kitchen was a train wreck. Dirty table, dirty appetizer plate, calamari was soft, dripping with grease and made us kind of nauseous after we ate about half of it. (In hindsight should have sent it back but we were really hungry) Left it and went on to entrees, mushy veggie curry and a gyro kisra that was basically dry bread topped with mounds of dry spinach and some gyro meat. Both were abandoned mostly untouched. I looked at my companion trying hard to politely eat her entree and said "Forget it, let's just get out of here".  She responded with no argument and a look of relief. Left $70++ lighter, pissed and without eating dinner.

Tried this place for the first time this week. Needed a break from the usual Biltmore corridor fare. Someone threw out the idea of bbq and this was closest. 

Large place, lots of seating at booths or tables (seat yourself) clean, dark and casual. Sparsely decorated with no real theme or atmosphere and a couple of TVs playing quietly. You order at the counter and they bring it to your table. Meats come un-sauced and they have three or four different sauces at a central counter you help yourself to. Crowd was sparse and a mix of suits and uniforms  service was friendly and competent and they explained how to order since it was our first time. 

My lunch mate had the pulled pork sandwich which is simply meat in a bun and a side of green chili Mac and cheese. 

I had a two meat combo with brisket and tri-tip and the Mac on the side and ordered a slice of the gooey butter cake for us to share. Combo comes with Texas toast. 

Pulled pork was excellent, smoky and well cooked. The brisket and tri-tip were ok, not horrible, not memorable and all my food, including the toast, was room temperature and dry. Mac and cheese are individual (not suitable for sharing as an FYI) a la carte portions and was tasty and heated through. Drinks are also self service and the ice tea was fresh and it appears they have beer, wine and cocktails. My lunchmate noted that the choices are "white" and "red" and are $9 a glass, cocktails are $7 and beers are $5, going on memory. 

Combined this very simple meal was about $35.00+ and frankly for that much was not comparable to what you'd get for the same money at many other places in the area, for instance at OSHO a short distance away that serves really great hit and juicy pulled pork, brisket and pastrami sandwiches with good sides in a slightly nicer environment, or for that matter Hillstones at the Biltmore, where we could have eaten for a comparable cost.

Great food in a small, loud restaurant and bar populated by neighborhood cougars and the men that love them, at least while they are there. As with any great steakhouse the side dishes  are the standout, at least for me (mac and cheese, spinach, mushrooms, whipped mashed potatoes etc) . Their seafood actually impressed more than the (very good) steaks and I've had halibut, tuna and the seafood tower there, all above average in quality, taste and value.  Heavy  wine list and strong cocktails lead to boisterous crowds. Severs are well trained and uniformly friendly based on at least 5 visits there. I'd go here over most comparable places in town, and PHX/Scottsdale has many high end steak places.

One of the better Asian buffets in the PHX Scottsdale area. They have a dozen plus varieties of freshly made sushi rolls, tempura, egg and spring rolls, a raw bar with shrimp, oysters and crab legs, some dim sum favorites and at least 20 hot Chinese entrees in addition to a massive desert bar, salads, fresh fruit and a Mongolian BBQ type raw fresh grill where you pick your meats and veggies and the chef stir fries it  for you while you wait. Everything is typically fresh and they keep the dishes full. Easy place to take a bunch of folks who all have different tastes and want something different because there's something for everybody even kids. It's a hell of a deal for 15 bucks at lunch. They charge more for dinner and throw in some extra items like prime rib. One interesting detail, it looks like a claim jumper restaurant inside because it used to be one. Antler chandeliers and all. Not quite as good as what you might find in LA or San Francisco but head and shoulders above most Asian buffets in Phoenix which tend to be nightmares of deep-fried meat, sweet-and-sour sauce and greasy noodles.

Very poor service, said they were too busy to even make us tea or take an order. Walked out unserved, there was only one other table. If you can't both fill a catering order and serve people, lock the door.

As a tribute to native son Andy Warhol the museum serves as a historical survey as well as a venue to display his art. Most interesting was the Victoria Museum's show comparing and contrasting Warhol's art and that of Ai WeiWei. How each artist uses similar themes to express different ideas was interesting and enlightening.

On a short visit to Pittsburgh we made a reservation at Altius to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We wanted to pick a special spot with atmosphere and the description of Altius filled the bill. Needless to say the view was spectacular and the fireworks after the Steelers game made it more so. The service was superb. We had the charcuterie and the Chinese duck bao as starters each of which was wonderful. We split the special aged rib steak which was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The dessert was the panacotta with mango which was as beautiful as it was delicious. All in all it was a wonderful way to celebrate our special day.

Having grown up in a typical Philly neighborhood I felt right at home at Deluca's. The street and the restaurant transported me back to my childhood. The food line, the counter stools, the friendly wait staff all made the experience special. My wife and I stuck with the usual breakfast fare.  French toast, eggs and bacon, hash browns, toast and coffee. Everything fresh and familiar. Living close to Baltimore it is a pity they could not save some of the old close-in shopping areas to create a draw such as the Strip.

Overall visit was good, but it could have been better. Check in had a long line, but it moved relatively quickly. Hotel is super quiet, so you will not have to worry about club noise or crazy neighbors. Had a few issues with my room. Not sure who or why anyone would want to mess up a hotel room, but furniture and walls were clearly damaged and never repaired. My tv remote was useless and took a ton of button presses before it did anything. Someone also decided to completely destroy the remote screen by the bed before my visit. It looked like someone pressed so hard on the screen that it destroyed the pixels and made it virtually useless. Took two calls to the front desk before these were finally exchanged. I was offered another room but on the 3rd floor? No thank you. Pretty sure there were plumbing issues in my room. Sink and tub drains were extremely loud, and toilet even flushed once on its own. One of the sink handles in the room was also broken. Get it together Aria!

This place is a hole in the wall good hotel. I've never had a problem in the many years I've gone here growing up. Every year I stay here with my family. The service is great and so are the hotel rooms. They have remodeled the rooms so they look a lot better. It's a tee bit away from the strip but not a big deal. Rooms at under $50 a night....can't complain.

This is my review for this restaurant on Google Maps. And unless they have changed their name recently, the correct name is Everest Hakka House.

This is an update to my last review. not 5 stars anymore. They recently cut their portions down by 25% and put the price up 1 to 4$ per dish. Not such a good deal now. Customer Service here sucks when you have a complaint, they just don't really care. Hence the reason for this review update. Recently they have messed up my order twice and have offered me a free dinner. When I went in to claim my free dinner, it was not in the system. This place is falling apart! I don't recommend it to anyone, anymore.
Excellent place to eat. They did have to close but they have since reopened. 6.95 everything on the menu. Excellent food. Good atmosphere.

Can't get enough of The Bodega. We work right around the corner so it's convenient and SO delicious. The tuna melt with Pimento is off da chain and today I had the Gmans Gwich for the first time and it may just be the best sandwich i've ever had. My favorite deli in Charlotte, for sure!

Worst fedex location. The two people that we're working were absolutely rude. Didn't acknowledge that I needed help. When I was leaving the store, one of the employees asked didn't you need a box? (With a rude tone) I would not recommend going to this location

I'm always absolutely in love with my eyebrows, since the first time, and every time I get a touch up. I religiously book appointments with Trudy every six months to keep them looking amazing. That might be overkill, but having perfect eyebrows, and NEVER filling them in, is a good enough reason for me. Trudy is amazing at what she does and I've never been disappointed. My brows are seriously perfect. She's very truthful  about the healing process and your skin type and how she thinks they'll heal. Everyones skin heals differently. After my first appointment the strokes had faded a bit and some disappeared, but after my touch up they were perfect. Her IG pictures depicting the shapes of different brows and the results are highly truthful and accurate.

Also if you're aware of her IG then you should be well aware of her following and the demand that brings for the amount of clients she has. If you expect an email back ten minutes after you send it, then that's your problem. And if you expect an appointment within a week, then that's also your misguided judgement. She's in high demand and like any quality high demand professional, bookings need to be made far in advance. Don't leave from your appointment with Trudy and not rebook your next one. If something comes up where you need to reschedule last minute, you're going to be booking months down the road again. No matter what I'm doing in the future, I make sure I'm available for my appointment; it's a priority for me especially knowing how in demand she is. 

I also always make sure to text her a few days in  advance to confirm and double check the appointment and her address. I've never had an issue.

She's wonderful to talk to during the appointment. Super kind, professional and considerate. Be aware and considerate of her policies and book your appointments in advance and there's no issues.

I love the store!!! Lots of great crystals & great staff. Maria help me understand how some crystals work & how I can use them on my everyday life style. This is my new favorite store  Maria went out of her way to help me find the best crystal that fit my needs. Thank you so much for your help and time.

Dr Cozine has been our family dentist  for over 15 years. He is an amazing human being and a very skilled professional. His office is modern, immaculate and efficient . He is caring and a true professional. Appointments run on time and he does not do any procedures unless absolutely necessary for your health. We send all our friends & clients to him and they love his office & staff. Give Dr Cozine a try , you will be glad you did.

The owner of Advantage landscape came out and spoke with my husband about our plans to utilize the SNWA for grass removal and desert landscape.  We found him to be very concerned about taking care of our needs.  We are in the process of working on new plans with one of his associates and hoping to proceed as soon as our HOA approves the pavestones and we can get that done.
Edgar is a true professional and did a great job . Will enjoy using his services in the future.

Another great job today trimming palms & removing a sick plum tree. The crew is efficient, professional and shows up when they say! They do book up in advance so I'm going to book for next year soon :)

Steve is exceptional and have used his services for quite a long time. He is a very busy guy , runs his business , like a business and shows up on time . We refer him to our friends and clients and they are pleased. He is a trustworthy individual and is creative & skilled to be able to fix challenging problems , right the first time! You will be glad you called him first .
Have been with Toni's pet sitters for many years and she is particular on how she does business and makes sure her staff is efficient and qualified to take care of your pet family.

They just finished a long front walk-way and steps today.  The crew is professional, shows up on time and does a great job!  Very professional and went the extra mile to make us happy.  We are very glad we chose this Company!
Great staff, great food. Best noodles we've had in a very long time and the chicken wings are
Excellent food, fun atmosphere and good service. This is a must try if you like Asian fusion!

I was looking forward to Shane's tonight. This location is training a new chef, however, and the chicken is overcooked and tough...that's the only reason for my less than great review this time.  Hopefully the next visit will be better!

A great place to have a drink with friends.
Food is mediocre but I don't hold that against them
The Kiss Pinball machine is fun and they have a great patio

I really like this place.  I stick with the curries and the Rama.  It is one of my staples.  I am glad it is getting better known.  I have been to several Thai places--but I like this one the best.

All of those I have introduced this place to have liked it as well.

This place was great. Super good service. Modern environment. Easy access. The prices were fair. Some of the best Indian cuisine we have eaten.  (There were chicken nuggets for the kids). 

There are three Indian restaurants in a row. We are glad we landed here. If we lived here, we would definitely work it into our foodie rotation.
Love this place.  The only problem is I have a hard time choose which meal to order.  It is a staple.

Just found this place. One in Tempe near Mill. One in Mesa near the fiesta Mall. 

Fantastic!  I have only been twice--in the last two days.  They make their own bread (Dutch crunch).  There are about 500 options.  The onion rings are great. 

Good prices. About $10.  Great food.   And they top it off with a free Carmel covered apple sucker.  Nice!

I will update with upcoming visits.  Can't wait!

If I had to choose between all Mexican Restaurants, I would choose this place.  It is, to me, the most authentic.  The staples are great: fried beef/chicken tacos; red enchiladas; rolled tacos; steak/chicken burros. The rice/beans at this place are the all time best.  For my taste, the salsas are just OK. I wish the food was more spicy. But this is a general problem north of the boarder. 

Try it. Love it. 

Note: I have only been posting about places I really like.  No sense wasting time on places I don't like.

We usually avoid food places on the tourist strips.  But we are glad we stopped here. The pizza as wonderful. The spaghetti was perfect. The chicken salad was another hit. 

Easy access. Good service. Fairly priced for being on the Royal mile.

This was the first place we ate on our trip. It was close to our AB&B. 

We might have simply been hungry. But whatever the case, the food hit the spot. 

We had Steak & Ale pie; fish and chips; chicken salad; and a Burger. Everyone was happy. 

It was a pleasant atmosphere. The service was great. The prices good. The food was tasty.

i have been to so may nail salon, and i have to tell you, the owner does the best nails i have ever had. i don't live close, but i will go out of my way to go to him. they last for 3 weeks and beautiful every nail is perfect! even if they speak in vietnameise, i don't care, the price is right and my nails look great!
i have been going to VCA Mountain View Animal Hospital since the early 2000's. Doctor walker and his staff are the best caring vets i have ever had the pleasure to meet and take care of my pets!

horrible! waste of 375.00. she talked the hole time about herself and her problems. did not listen to how "I" wanted them done! they are not solid one is longer than the other and very thin! this was in two sittings too! so very disappointing! feeling totally ripped off! never went back for the third sitting because she could not even come close to getting it right in two sittings!

Holy cats!! This was the best choice we made on our vacation!  The hamburger was fabulous with a fresh baked roll as the bun. The sweet potato fries were the best I have ever had anywhere. Service was great and this is a worthy stop!!

cousins brought me here. The sweet potato fries are ok not a fan of the place its a chain so things feel to corporate. The workers here felt like they were about to die and the sight of us made them smile for help. The food wasnt that good and over priced. The island feel... i dont get it, which islands? Caribbean or Pacific? its cool to play bob marley but make up your mind on the items.
My wife had the chicken boxty and I had the Shepard's pie. Both were wonderful and we would come back again for sure.  Service was good but I could see it slowing as they got busier. We will be back!

Well this is my first time at this location I read the reviews and they were kind of mixed so I decided to try it anyway needless to say I will not be back unfortunately I was stuck with getting Danny to do my pedicure and the pedicure itself was okay but it just wasn't as personable and relaxing as I normally have had in the past when it got to the painting time he kept trying to get me to get a French tip color that I did not want and I kept telling him I want cappuccino with a French tip he kept saying oh you need cotton candy and I kept having to say I do not want cotton candy after I found a color he painted my toes and I had to keep telling him are you going to fix that are you going to fix that I think I could have painted this better than what he did it was just not a very good  pedicure that I wanted. The only reason I gave it a 2-star is because the actual massage chair was the best thing about my visit hints if you do try going here don't go to Denny.

I can't say enough about the staff here.I was sad that Ajay left but after speaking with her grandmother who happens to be the manager Ms.Linda who is absolutely the gem of this establishment I understood her reasoning.I normally come in the mornings for my breakfast before heading to work,i have never had an incorrect order and I always get enough napkins which now seems to be hard to come by at fast food places.Its just a great start to my day when i see Ms.Linda and she is such a delight and joy to my start of my hectic days.

My friend from work have been raving and raving about this place and she always comes here after church so one night before we all hung out we was like let's all go to dinner so we suggest it Island flavor and oh my God out of the park I loved everything about it they gave you big portions of food it's very inexpensive the food is taste fresh it was just awesome way way way way way better than Aloha Kitchen I had the combination plate  and it was amazing. We will definitely make this our favorite food place.

So finally this place open we are regulars at the oyster bar at Palace Station we decided we needed to try this place because it's much closer to home and we were tired of the three-hour wait for Palace Station which is by the way very well worth it so we came to the oyster bar at Santa Fe Station we were seated and greeted by the manager I believe his name is John super cool dude love him he was awesome if it wasn't for him we would have left the restaurant we are seated at the bar it took about maybe 25 minutes before the server Corey who had horrible customer service to come and greet us. 2 people were seated next to us and their server gave them water gave them bread took their order before our server even came to ask us if we wanted anything to drink.We had to end up calling over John to find out what's going on with the server she was walking back and forth in front of us several times before she even took our orders or even made eye contact.We ordered the kitchen pan roast I believe with Lobster it was good the food was great awesome it's up there with the original Palace Station oyster bar but the customer service from Corey made my experience horrible. We had to ask Kory to refill our drinks and it took us like 3 or 4 times to get her attention she would not paying any attention we had to like kind of like I had her down to actually get her to see it and we're sitting at the bar to get her to fill our drinks when we got ready to go we needed to go bags she says oh I have other orders in front of you so just wait a minute when she bagged up our food she threw our bread away which is really good she threw the bread away I didn't have any bread to eat when I brought my food home. That's pretty much it luckily I love food so the experience was horrible but you know I'll give it another try because I do love the food there but Corey I hope you read this and really take note on your attitude

So I was really excited when I first saw this sign going up and they were building this because I am originally from California and I am a super huge fan of Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles so my fiance came and picked me up from work for lunch one day and he was like let's try this place can't go wrong with chicken and waffles. I was wrong it was not it was definitely not Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles the sides were very Bland and had no taste the chicken were big pieces which I was surprised about,the waffle was just okay it wasn't something to write home about the service did take forever but the server was super nice.The prices were a lot compared to other places I have been to..
What a great place to hangout with friends after drinks and gambling. This's my second trip to Las Vegas and always love to come here! The service is awesome and the food is great!!

Trying this place for the first time and didn't expect this place to be this good! The food was awesome!! I ordered chicken tikka masala and it's really delicious, it's not to overwhelming with the Indian spices, it's just the right amount of it. If I come back to Las Vegas, I'll definitely be back here again.

Please don't eat here!!! We were in Las Vegas for the first time and stayed at the Mandalay Bay and happened to try this buffet .... I was so surprised how lame the buffet was ... it's like an ordinary Chinese buffet; I'm sorry for saying that but I was really disappointed. Seriously don't eat here, with the same price you can get the best buffet at the Cosmopolitan.

Found this place while browsing in Las Vegas .... the food is awesome and very authentic!! A must try if you're by the Flamingo and Caesar Palace. The only reason I have 4 instead of 5 stars is that they don't have just beef by itself but beef with lamb.

Love love love!! Can't get enough of this store, the owner Taucha and the girls that work there are all fantastic! Talk about amazing selection of clothing, jewels, gifts and lots of laughs. They are so helpful, go above and beyond and always give an honest opinion about what I try on because they want to make sure I leave happy..which I always do! I recommend everyone I know to go there and shop, not only will you leave satisfied with your purchase it feels like you made new girlfriends by how comfortable the staff makes you feel. And their Instagram is also amazing, they post all of the new merchandise and if you aren't nearby and see something you like they will hold it for you or ship!!
I love this restaurant. The atmosphere is quaint and the food is excellent! My favorite date night spot in Chandler.

These rooms were awesome!! I have never felt so comfortable and welcomed at a Vegas hotel in the past 20 years of coming. The front desk concierge was super friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and we had an amazing view.
We look forward to coming back.
This place has made me a better artist all around.  The teachers are very informative and patient.
OH EMM GEEE!! This is the families favorite place to eat. The Swarma Tortilla is DEE -LISH so if you are confused on what to get...get that. Man.. now my mouth is watering. Nom Nom Nom.

I must say that this is the best dentist office that I have ever been to. I purchased a Groupon for Invisiline at almost half of what other offices were charging.  When you walk into the office it is nicely decorated and the staff is friendly.They also have coffee and water in the waiting area and a toothbrush with toothpaste just in case you forgot to brush your teeth before you came in. Definitely recommend!

Update: A few years ago, I moved two hours away from All About You. I often thought about making the drive to get botox and filler from Dawn as I never felt 100% comfortable with the injectors in my area. I finally moved back to closer to All About You and booked my appointment as soon as possible. In the time I was gone, All About You has moved locations and the new facility is beautiful! I was not disappointed by my long awaited visit back. I was greeted by Jordan at the front desk who was very helpful and sweet. Of course, Dawn did not disappoint with her flawless injections and awesome customer service. She is the only person I trust to do the job right. All About You is still living up to their name.

Ok so I have struggled with back pain for about 10 years now. I have tried everything and I must say, it has been about a month and my back pain has reduced about 95 percent since my cupping/massage treatment. For the first time in years, I can workout without my pain setting me back, I can sit and watch movies without the nagging of my sciatica. A must try if you struggle with chronic pain. Very nice customer service.

Just came back from a very disappointing breakfast.  We have dined here before and never had a problem.  This time was very different.  Not sure if under new management or cutting cost but will not come back.
