Let me start by saying that I love Guy's suggestions for the most part.  Salsa Brava in Flagstaff is excellent.  Everything Guy described and more.  The same goes for Chino Bandido in Phoenix, it's just as he described.  I tried Roberto's at the gas station that was also highlighted on DDD.  It's slightly better than Los Taquitos.  First off, Los Taquitos had no fountain soda, it was out of order. I ordered the 3 taco plate because the atmosphere was questionable.  The place wasn't as clean as I would like so I wanted to order safe.  My husband ordered the relleno plate.  My taco shells were burnt.  His relleno was soggy.  The only good part was the rice and beans.  I didn't see any chips and salsa on the menu either.  The bathroom was pretty bad too.  The floor was filthy and there was a hole in the wall that was stuffed with t.p. Don't get me wrong, I can slum it for some great authentic food but I don't see the appeal of Los Taquitos.  I felt ripped off and regret going.
First time at this particular location. No complaints!  We bought a pound of fajita meat to cook at home. It was delicious! Great prices and clean store. I will definitely be back!

This was my first experience only because I received a gift card. It was delightful and I enjoyed the free bottle of water.  Everyone was completely helpful and friendly! I will be back only if I receive another gift card lol:)

This was our first visit to this buffet. It was WS or B since I wanted to try a new buffet on this trip. As soon as we arrived in Vegas this was our first stop, even before checking into our Tower Suite at the Wynn. We walked right up hungry and excited. We paid and were seated immediately at a 2 person table directly in front of the buffet. In my periph I could see the bone marrow which was going to be my first stop. I have never had bone marrow but I was anxious to try it after reading the reviews here on Yelp. It was served with a kimchi sauce drizzled on it and it was delicious. We also tried the prime rib which was excellent. The sushi was fantastic as well. Loved the duck confit lentil and angry mac n cheese. I thought the service was excellent and the waiters were very attentive. 

Overall we were impressed and we will definitely be back.

I had the asada torta and he has the torta Ahogada. We also ordered the chips and guac, a Strawberry Jarritos and diet coke. My  torta was good. Just as I expected. His torta had literally no meat on it. It would have been an amazing sandwich if there had been more than a sliver of pork. The guac wasn't impressive either. I don't think I will be back unless I am in a pinch. Not the best torta IMO. Los Reyes holds that title in my book for now.
Loved it! The asada and pastor was on point! Tortillas were fresh and authentic. Salsas were great! I also had a Kissi roll and that was bomb! I will be back!

They were off tonight. For some reason they were really slow and not as pleasant as usual.  I will come back of course.  Just goes to show that nobody is perfect.  I was starting to think this location was. I ordered a white chocolate latte and is wasn't as good as usual.  They made my husband's drink a small instead of medium. Maybe it was just a case of the after Christmas blues.

I love this store. The employees are very knowledgeable and helpful.  My go - to when I have an issue with my plants or need products.  This location seems to be expanding also. Good for them! They have taken over the suite next store.

I went into ABC Hyundai Las Vegas, NV and spoke with two employees.  My credit was not strong enough to purchase a vehicle on my own even though I make a great deal of money per year from my government job.  Okay, Sure understandable.  One of the managers scolded me for helping in signing for too many OTHER cars...then he aggressively insisted that others help me sign into a vehicle in the same manner in which I helped them sign into theirs.  I left the establishment browsing vehicles as I left knowing I would eventually be back because I like Hyundai engineering and the location was convenient to the freeway.  My departure browsing was mostly for show because they made me feel humiliated and I'm a hard working gentleman...so I didn't want to give them the satisfaction of leaving "tuck tail" beaten dog like.  The original salesman met me outside as I was leaving the establishment and encouraged me if I could convince my mother to return with me she could sign with me and I could get a car.  I went home and talked it over with my mom.  While home, ABC Hyundai called and assured us we would leave with a car if only I could get my mother APPLY ONLINE then return with me as a co signer.  I explained to them I could have money down but not until a few days later after I get paid.  It was 730pm and my 59 year old mom worked at 5am the next day.  She agreed to help me because she has a kind and caring heart.  We returned to ABC Hyundai and they started the credit process AGAIN because for "Some reason" they couldn't locate her online application that SHE JUST SENT ONLINE BEFORE LEAVING THE HOUSE.  So after another 9 minutes AFTER ARRIVING and recollecting my mothers info into their tablet...all of the workers huddled back in their offices with my mothers NEWLY ACQUIRED information  EVEN THOUGH SHE ALREADY SENT IN AN ONLINE APPLICATION.  They eventually came out...offering a "Gift" that would only be approved in my mothers name because my own credit history was too negative.  The "gift" offered was a single choice of vehicle...their smallest, and the oldest vehicle that had been test driven for over 1 year.  The 2018's are on the lot...and they only offered her a 2017 with over 60 miles on the odometer (the test drive was only 4 miles).  Okay, sure understandable.  Fair, enough.  Whatever...that's all I could say.  Perhaps they could have mentioned that all to us.  I brought my mother back into their lot....the fact that my name wouldn't be on the registration and all the pressure would alllll be on just my mom alone was kept secret.  They already ran my credit beforehand.  They had my mothers credit from the ABC Hyundai website WHICH SHE SENT IN 45 minutes prior...they could have had things figured out BEFORE we arrived since my down payment was already written on paper as to what date I could provide it.  So after explaining the "Gift" on how they're going to clear their inventory and shift us a year old dinosaur....they asked...yes, wait for it.....HOW I WOULD BE PUTTING THE MONEY DOWN!!!???  Facepalm..."You guys don't remember telling you clearly that I have no money down today???"  Seems they selectively forgot that fact.

So we sign and we're out of there by 1030pm.  My poor mother needs rest but is excited to help introduce a vehicle into the family (Even though I will be making the payments myself, we call it HER car :)  ).  So the next day she must return to deliver the cash which they THOUGHT I was going to deliver the 1st night, even though I clearly stated....NO MONEY TONIGHT AT ALL...LATER MONEY YES....NONE TONIGHT...LATER YES...NONE TONIGHT....
We sign a few more papers which were over looked the 1st day.  Okay, great now everything is in order.  Right???

Turns out they forgot ANOTHER item and now me and my mom had to return a THIRD time.  One of the dates on the original contract was not updated the 2nd time around and either we come back a 3rd time to sign, or we would be lacking a particular vital insurance coverage.  So, yes of course we returned for a 3rd visit.  

It feels strange to sign a contract that says, "once you leave the lot you are the owner of the vehicle in which there's no backing out"....but then to be slammed with several messages for days afterwards which state...return to the lot or else the original deal will be modified.

So the experience was completed, yes.  Yes, we did get the car.  Yes, they did work with us eventually.  But it felt as though a court trial, circus, and comedy ROAST were were all combined into one package.  No not very pleasant.  I told them I will need another car in 30 days...but I'now I'm hesitant.  Do I really want to submit myself to that treatment again??  I'm happy to have a vehicle which I can pay for...but must I be humiliated and made to come back time and time again?  Nobody even offered Coffee or Cocoa like they did on the 1st night!  :(
Coffee/Cocoa must be hot brewed and takes time....they will only volunteer water unless you ask otherwise...

Visited twice to the India Palace restaurant on my trip to Las vegas. The ambience is good. As soon as you enter, you could see the photos of various bollywood stars which sets very high expectations but the taste and quality does not live up to the standards. Both the times of my visit, we had buffet for lunch. The idly is supposed to be soft and fresh but it's the exact opposite. The sambar tastes sweet. For the desert, they served mango custard with cut fruits inside which is purely an essence and not freshly prepared. The north Indian sabji were not great. The rice, dhaal and raita was good and tasty. Overall the restaurant is not as advertised and does not live up to the high yelp review ratings.

Flat tires are so unpleasant. I had one on the independence day last week and i was fortunate enough to find Superior Tires right outside the place i visited at E Warm Springs Rd. As it was a national holiday elsewhere, they were all booked up and were closing early by 4 pm. Nevertheless, the executive was kind enough to take my car to repair the flat tire. Within 20 min my car was all ready to go; and guess what! the flat tire was done free of cost. Couldn't be a more happy customer. Thank you for the wonderful service.

Don't be fooled by the illusion that this apparently family-friendly-cafe projects. Bruno, the owner, has to be one of the nastiest pieces of work I have ever encountered in the hospitality industry. Having reluctantly given him my custom for the past 2 years (as I live in the neighbourhood), I am now boycotting his establishment after he asked me to leave when I sat down with my food, because apparently, you have to order a drink with it if you want to stay. He is extremely belligerent and constantly makes a scene in front of everybody. He hates students and old people (I was fortunate enough to hear his views on the elderly once); actually, it's become clear to me after reading other reviews that Bruno just hates everybody - which is fine with me, but not if you're going to run a cafe and project your hatred onto your paying customers.


 As far as the food goes, it's extremely average, and way overpriced for what it is.


 It's a burning shame that Fuel Deli is now closed (they used to be opposite Cafe Artista). If you're looking for a good deli, friendly staff, and a distinct absence of hostility, walk down Melville Terrace and go to Victor Hugo. Trust me, it's worth it - avoid Cafe Artista at all costs.

Eric did an awesome job and was extremely efficient. I appreciated that he was the first company to reach out to me and that he was very friendly. The combo of the value of his service and fair price was ideal.
Barry offered me the best quote and offered me the speediest response time to get a new car for my car. That is the ideal combination. I'm thrilled I chose him, which was an easy decision.
I unfortunately know too many companies who fix broken iPhones and can confidently say this one is the best I've been to.

Outrageously expensive. We are loyal to Seville Dry Cleaners and this a good example of why. We just moved to the area and needed something closer for this one instance (OUR WEDDING). We knew we would pay extra, but had no idea it'd be $148 instead of our usual $75 for a similar amount of clothes -- literally double. A mark up of $15-20 makes sense, 100 percent increase is disgusting. Among all of the local small business I've ever been to this one makes my list of most regrettable. Biggest rip off of my life, no exaggeration. Extremely false advertising of $$/two dollar signs.

I have bought two bikes from Chandler Harley Davidson, and my father has purchased one. We have both had fantastic experiences. The sales staff, specifically Steve with internet sales, is very informative and it's a low pressure sales environment. The first bike I bought there, was the first motorcycle I had ever owned or ridden. They explained everything and even got me signed up with a riding class that teaches you the basics and gets you your motorcycle endorsement. For my second purchased I went back and again received exceptional service. The staff goes above and beyond to get you the bike your looking for. The bikes themselves have been above expectation. Quality motorcycles, that I now only associate with the Harley Davidson brand. This is a great dealership and I would recommend it to anyone.

I don't usually go to a hotel restaurant with high expectations, so I was pleasantly surprised when my food arrived. I ordered the Organic Celery Ceaser, and was definitely impressed. A very unique salad of julienned celery, some romaine, garlic croutons, parmesan, and a flavourful dressing. Plus my server Brittany was great!  Big thumbs up.

Horrible experience! Just regretted going there. We got our order after 45 minutes!  And when we got it the biryani was cold which is supposed to be piping hot to be able to enjoy it.  The nihari was just soup without taste. We just wanted to finish our food and we promised ourselves never to go back! The food was not up to the mark considering the competition in that area and a little too expensive for the typical Indian restaurant. We paid the woman at the counter and later realized that she had charged us $10 extra. Will never go back!

I hired the Wrap It Up Food Truck for an employee appreciation event.  Chef Anthony, Shannon and Laura were a fantastic group to work with and helped get the employees engaged in games while they wanted for their wraps.  Every single one of my employees raved about the wraps and left happy and full!  Thank you to Wrap It Up Food Truck for a great employee appreciation event and delicious wraps.

I went to Bomba with a group of 11. When we arrived and told the hostess how many we had she acted as if we told her we had 20 people in our party.  She told us she didn't know when we would be seated.  After waiting an hour and a half we checked on the status of our table. We watched customers come and go while we still had no table.  Finally after two hours of waiting they had an 8 top open up (not sure why it took two hours for an 8 top to open) we all squeezed in and finally was able to get chairs for all of us.  I understand that they just opened but in the future there will be large groups and they need to learn how to accommodate. 

Our problems did not stop there. We all were seated and ordered drinks, appetizers and our meal.  We received warm water in small cups.  It took 20 minutes for us all to receive our drinks and then about 30 minutes for us to receive chips and guacamole.  Not everyone's came out at the same time. The guacamole was warm with not a lot of flavor and I didn't care for the chips.  We finally received our tacos- they were average and nothing special.  My friends ordered the bacon wrapped jalapeños and the waitress never told them that they ran out of jalapeños.  We never received a refill on waters.  The manager tried to make up for everything by giving us dessert and shots. But the dessert wasn't even good.  I will return one more time to see if anything improves 

My first impression, I would never return. The service was bad and the food was ok. It's worth a chance to try and hopefully you have a better experience.

We went this afternoon to try this place, myself, my mom, my 7 year old son, my 2 year old daughter, and 1 year old son, we did not get to order as it isn't for families that has children requiring high/booster seat as they don't have it, I asked the server who greeted us how will they accommodate families with young children and he just shrugged his shoulder!!  Will never go back !

Time for an update, as I've been going here a few times a month ever since they opened. Service speed inside the restaurant has improved somewhat, and the management seems to be more attentive about covering off on drink refills for customers lurking at the counter.

Fact of the matter is - if you've been to a Chick-fil-A, you've been to this Chick-fil-A. They're all consistent and this one is no longer an exception with their improvements to service. I do appreciate that they don't play religious music in the restaurant, though, which is something I find annoying at a few other local Chick-fil-A's. I'm a heathen and I'm there for my guilty chicken fix, don't try to convert me. 

One start docked for a simple reason: The booths are starting to get worn and overall the restaurant is beginning to show its age. Everything doesn't need to be sparkling new, but if someone has slashed the vinyl in one of the booth seats, get it fixed, yaknow? The profit margins should cover general maintenance.

I'd give no stars if permitted. I may attend other Buffalo Wild Wings but not this location in Goodyear. This isn't the first time I've had bad service at this location, but it was the worst customer service experience I've ever had. In  speaking to others they have also shared their experiences with poor customer service at this location.  I live in Goodyear so it's unfortunate. I had a waitress who first thought it excusable to not wait my table for more than 20 minutes after being seated, then she tried lie by saying she wasn't our waitress, to make maters worse she claimed my husband was cursing at her(which he never even gave a tone like he was using foul language) and the worst part is she continued to harass us by returning to our table after I had requested the manager. I finally decided to walk to the counter to ask for the manager myself she followed me continuing to harass me. The manager wasn't much better.  His Initial response was his response to my email and his response was very nice but I felt he was more concerned with making excuses for his employee. He was checking with the host to see if maybe tables were switched on her or something that could have thrown her off. I don't think that should matter, regardless of the reason, there should be no excuse for that type of behavior. He did apologized and asked if there was anything he could do for us. I was not looking for handouts,  but in my past experience with poor service, the management has never asked me if there is anything they could do for me. Instead they took the initiative to try and make things right. Then I received an email response which stated "We strive very hard to make orders correct the first time, but we are only human and we sometimes make mistakes." This was spilled water, that would be a mistake. This was behavior issues. There is so much more I could say but I won't. I will just never return to this restaurant and will tell everyone I know about this experience. 

Sent from my iPhone

I would recommend this dentist office every one was extremely nice, helpful, and friendly from the point you walk-in to the time you leave. They take the time to answer any questions or concerns you might have in a friendly and professional way. Prices are reasonable, I have NO complaints. This has been the best dentist office I have ever visit. I will not exchange them for any other dentist. This will be my family's dentist office going forward. I recommend it 100%, extremely satisfied!
I'm very happy. I've had to printings now the colors are consistent each time. Fast turnaround as well!
I can't say enough good things about this company.  Nate is definitely focused on providing the best customer service around.  Such hard workers and willing to go out of their way to help you out.

We were hungry, this place was on or list to try because of Yelp. It got rid of the hunger and removed a check from or list, but nothing much to write about.

The people I'm sure are very nice.. The food is par, nothing special or with a unique twist. The breakfast specials seem to be pretty affordable.

The specials posted on the walls are the best bet for you. Put the menu down an stare at the walls.
Excellent!  Got the beef shawarma with carrot/cabbage salad and partner had falafel stick wrap.  Wonderful food and great/friendly service.  Worth the drive!

OH, WHAT A NIGHT =)

I am really not a broadway fan, but I loooove music from The Four Seasons and this show was spectacular!! It gave me warm and fuzzy feelings inside. The story behind their struggles and drama into the music industry and fame and behind their personal lives was captivating... SUCH a perfect performance! I got so excited recognizing the songs I hadn't expected... what I would give to come back and see it again!! "Bye Bye Baby" really put a tear in my eye!! AAHHHH SO GOOD :) I should have bought the soundtrack while I was there... oh well time to order online!

I would definitely recommend this show to EVERYONE!

I came here to get coffee to keep myself from passing out during the 1.5 hour wait in line for Wicked Spoon! Their coffee is nice, high quality. The fact that they are inside the Cosmopolitan gives you an idea that you will be spending more than at other coffee shops.

Be aware that they do charge 25 cents if you ask for a cup of tap water.

First I have to preface the review with some background. I am from Italy and make all my own homemade pasta, gravy and Italian ethnic food.  If you want outstanding food with homemade pasta and experience an owner Vincenzo who cares about his guests and food get in you car, plane, taxi or whatever and get there as fast as you can. I have eaten Italian food in many places, New York, Boston and overseas and this in my opinion is 6 stars.

I travel for work A LOT and am very picky about my hotels.  They've renovated this place and I love it.  Modern, open rooms with simple but classy furnishings.  Very neat and clean.  On bed comfort I'd say 8.5 out of 10. Several kinds of pillows so you can choose if you want softer or firmer. Floors not carpeted, which is rare and I like it.  You just never know what germs are hanging out in a carpet! Love the big flat screen TV and the lounging half sofa on the side- super comfy.  Closet lights come on when you open the doors which is super helpful.  Decent lighting for the room and GREAT lighting in the bathroom (so you don't have to guess if you're putting your eyeshadow on your eye or your nose).  Modern shower with one of those really nice rain shower heads + a shower head you can detach and use all over the place.    You don't have to pay for parking and I've never had trouble finding a spot.  In a great area.  Love this hotel!

My guess is that this place will have no shortage of 5 star ratings.  First it's adorable.  The atmosphere is so COZY.  You really want to sit there and drink tea and read a book.  The actual food- amazing!  I had a ham and gruyere pastry that I could have eaten 50 of.  The macarons are the real deal- not the texture-less things you usually get here in the US.  Their tortes are fantastic as was the sea salt caramel brownie.  And the hot chocolate- you get a big fat mug and it's really good stuff!  I travel to Charlotte every few months for work and this will now be a mandatory stop for me on future visits!
Service was terrible.  Asked me for my order 3 times then brought out pizza instead of calzone.  Worst garlic knots ever BUT the calzone was really really good.

Oh wow! I wish I could have eaten everything in there.  The cakes were beautiful, but I just needed some sugar so I tried the cream horn (to die for) decorated cookie (very good) and an almond horn (amazing).  I don't live in Charlotte but if I did I'd be there a lot- and I'd HAVE to get a cake.  (P.s. The picture of the cake here doesn't do their cakes justice.)
Very authentic. Even better Pho than some places in Southern California.  I ordered take out. It was ready on time and warm when I got to the hotel.
Excellent service and staff. Plenty of smoke free sections in the casino and not too smokey elsewhere. Nice and clean environment with newly renovated rooms! Great views of the strip!

Try the Prime Choice bone in filet mignon. Very intimate atmosphere with dim lighting. We decided to enjoy Thanksgiving dinner while vacationing in Vegas and were more than pleased with the amazing experience. Will return.
Decent selection of drinks and quality service staff. Very appealing decorations with comfy and modern seating.
Brunch go-to every time I'm at the Palazzo! The prices are a bit high but service is great. Mimosas are always a great pairing with their chicken n waffles!
Great place to party and forget what you did. The drinks are pretty pricey but they do offer buy one get one. The drinks are known to catch up on you

Cara our server for the afternoon and she was very well versed with the menu options. She recommended their twist on the Moscow Mule for the ladies and recommended her personal favorite which was their twist on the old fashioned for me. Excellent choice, Cara! Can't wait to return.
These guys are extremely talented and go the extra yard to take personal photos post show. Enjoy!
Decent selection but a bit over priced for their steaks. Great service and relaxing ambience.

My boyfriend and I chose Cowboy Ciao as the setting to take our parents who were meeting each other for the first time. Coincidentally, it was also our first time dining here, and boy, was it nothing short of phenomenal! What an amazing experience. Sure, the restaurant is a little old, but at night, the place is dark with candles surrounding the area. Such a romantic place, perfect for a date, and in our case, a meeting. What we really loved is that there was no music playing, so it was perfect for conversation amidst some incredible wine. If you were interested in buying a bottle, be sure to check online before you go in to dine here. They have over 2,000 wines, and it is pretty difficult to navigate once you are actually there. Anyway, amazing wine program, our server was wonderful, the food was to die for, and we will definitely be back. I'll be craving that mushroom pan fry for the rest of my life!

Some of the best hummus I've ever had, hands down. And I've eaten a loooot of hummus. I love this place because everyone here is so sweet to everyone and treats you as though you are a part of their family. Try the falafel deluxe platter and you have a meal for two days; not to mention, it makes for some delicious leftovers.

Loved the atmosphere... Off from the strip which was a nice change of pace. We don't drink wine so felt the wine that was included in your meal was a waste, but had a great experience! The service was also great!

Loved the good, and service was great. We had a party of 6 and we waited 45mins...not bad! Everyone had something different but everyone loved there food! Amazing combination of food which made the tastes very unique and delicious! Would recommend for anyone!!!

I'm not a fan of cafeteria style eating and waiting in line for at least 20 minutes just to order is not my thing.  I definitely wouldn't bring young kiddos here, you'll go out of your mind waiting for the food after waiting in line.  Also, sometimes you are forced to share tables with strangers and it is definitely not a great place for a private conversation.

All that being said, the food is good.  They use quality ingredients and create some delicious dishes.  It's not a cheap meal, but it's a meal you won't forget.

It's a good place to start a pub crawl. We usualy start and work our way into Old Town from there. The tablemade guacamole is where it's at though! I get it everytime and have never been disappointed. The margarita samplers are a great way for a group to get the night started. We usually get 2 or 3 samplers for 4 people and pass them around so everyone can find their favorite margarita (tip, keep your straw!).

My kiddos have been going to this center for over three years now and I couldn't be happier!  My toddler literally hugs his teachers every day before leaving and my one year rarely cries with the drop off.  

Marie, the director, is fantastic.  She is always out and about in the Center and is actively involved in each classroom.  The teachers are also amazing.  It's very obvious they have a vested interest and care about in the development of the kids.  There are science experiments and lots of creative play in the classrooms.  It's has been a wonderful experience to watch my kids grow and develop.

One of my kids has a dietary issue and this KinderCare works hard to make sure his needs are met and that he's not ostracized for not being able to eat everything the other kids eat.  The entire process of discovering his food allergies to making sure there is no cross-contamination was done smoothly.  I have nothing but confidence in the caretaking here.

Dr. Gawley is the best. He completed my reconstruction post double mastectomy. I could not be happier with my final results. Dr. Gawley was consistently available for questions both before and after the surgery. He turned something very scary into an uplifting (no pun intended) experience.

His staff is friendly, yet  professional. Appointments almost always run on time, but if I walked in and it was an extra 5 minute wait, they gave an immediate heads up. The staff is also knowledgeable and discreet which is greatly appreciated.

AMAZING!  This place delivers every single time.  The burritos are huge and the spicy is right on.  We love bringing people from out of town here for some delicious Mexican.  The salsa bar never disappointments either.

If you are looking for some heat, get the green chile burro.  It never disappoints.  The chicken diablo burro is another favorite with a good punch of flavor.  Burritos are your best bet for bang for your buck.  Some of the entres are undersized for the cost.  But, they are still getting a 5 for the flavors alone.

I've been going too CWH since 2003.  I think I can safely say that I've seen most of the staff there.  The office is in a great location, shaded parking is available too 

Dr. O'Sullivan is my primary doctor there, she delivered both of my children.  Her bedside manner is friendly, yet professional.  I appreciate (love) her candid approach to my questions.  Mostly, I'm very thankful for her guidance and support when I tested positive for the breast cancer gene.  She's an amazing doctor and person.

The other 3 doctors or nurse practitioners are great for filling in if it's an emergency situation as well.  The front office staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  They are quick to return to calls as well.  I recommend CWH to every girl friend I've got (especially those with little ones on the way).  The service and care received is outstanding.

Update to my previous review. A change of ownership occurred and Mike is even better! He is always on time and incredibly quick to address any issues with the pool.  His cost to make any repairs has always been fair and he's very open about any alternative options in equipment. We couldn't be happier with the service we receive and highly recommend Mike.

Love this Mexican food!  It's absolutely delicious and definitely authentic.  It's not super fancy and they don't serve alcohol, but it totally hits the spot.  There is good heat to the green chile and I love the tortillas used.

Customer service is great, but you may want to have a back up plan if it's late in the evening.  The hours listed are until 9pm, but more times than not, they are closed by 8 during the week.

It's a good place for lunch in Phoenix. The food is inexpensive and the service is always friendly. They also deliever but the last time I ordered delivery, it was well over an hour by the time my food arrived. I either eat there now or order ahead and go pick up.  

The vegetarian pita with hummus is really good. They sautee the vegetables and always put plenty of hummus on the pita. I always get a side of fruit with it because the fruit is always fresh and a good selection. Most places just do melons for fruit cups, but this place includes berries, kiwis, and grapes which make for a great dessert after lunch. It's a lot of food though, so come hungry or be prepared to leave some on the table.

A fancy hot pocket made with fresh ingredients in a wide selection of choices. They don't do custom orders, your pasty comes as is. I've tried a bulk of them, but the cajun chicken continues to be my fav, it's just spicy enough. Sunday is all day happy hour and the beer selection is pretty nice too. I only wish they had a hostess, almost every time I go there, I've been sat at a table that had more people coming so my group wouldn't fit.

Delicious New Mexican cuisine! They don't do mild. 

The staff is friendly and will keep you glass full, but beware that it's not the quickest service. This is definately a place to go and unwind and take your time eating.

Food- I've never had anything I didn't like here. The adovada ribs are great and ridiculously hot. But my personal fav, is the spicy guacamole, made fresh and guaranteed to make you sweat. The red chili burro enchilada style another hit out of the ballpark. They used to have a great green chili stew, but sadly it's was a limited time menu item.

We went on a Friday night to watch our friend's band play. Food is good, but standard bar food so don't expect fine dining.

The vibe is great though and makes this dive bar worth going to again and again. The live music plays regularly and the bartenders keep your glass (or can depending on what your drinking) full. I think my favorite thing about the bar is the Nintendo decor throughout and the game console hookup near the back room. If you're looking for a low-key evening with good music, keep this place in mind.

I shop here from time to time, and wouldn't recommend it unless you are in a bind. The selection is so-so, the salad bar has an actually pretty competitive price per pound, but it doesn't feel very safe and not all of the clientel feel that upstanding. The worst part is the general indifference between the staffers. The concept of customer service just doesn't seem to exist, and even the managers don't seem to care. Just today I had a basket I no longer needed at check out. The cashier offered to take it from me so I passed it over. She then proceeded to drop it off somewhere and have a minute long conversation with another coworker, her boss.

This was all after I waited in another line only for something to break at a cash register, and me to have to get in line again. Plus many people seem to take their sweet time at checkout. I recommend Daves only if it's still daytime, and you are clearly not shopping at peak hours. That's it. The so-so selection is the only reason the store gets two stars.
Yup, went back on 9/15/14, we should have gone to bahamma breeze. The food is okay, but chips are still lame, and the time it took to get the food was too long for our group.
The very best Chinese.  Have always loved the Ambience.  Used to the Rancho Mirage, Temecula & Carlsbad CA locatiions but Henderson Green Valley is so good too!

WOW!!  Every review is a ONE Star. I totally believe it and if I could rate it a minus I would.  They failed the residents of Elevate in simply NOT taking care of business while still demanding HIGH rents.  Want to warn everyone about this Company!
Great Restaurants!  The Buffet is so pretty & has the best Italian food.  Fun place to hang out.

We tried the Street Tacos & Vampire Tacos (flat tostada).  The Carnitas & Chicken Street Tacos were really good.  Disappointed in the Vampire Taco.  Thought it was a Street soft Taco but it was a burnt flat tostada.  Will go back for the Street Tacos only.  Glad to see more Mexican food coming to Henderson!
Really good Mexican food.  The bean dip is a nice touch along with the salsa & chips.  Great lunch specials & what a view!
Pasta Cucina is our favorite Italian!  The Eggplant Parmesan & Chicken Parmesan are absolutely the best.  We've had our whole family here for Christmas Eve and all holidays!  Love the decor too.
We love your battered Green Beans with a Teriyaki dip. Used to the Murrieta, CA location.  The ones in Henderson need to improve a bit but still satisfies!

Don't waste ur time and money here !!! The food is very greasy and nothing so fresh .  You may end up with a bad indigestion so be careful whaf u order. The sides taste outta of a old can so nothing even close to "home-made"; first tried salvadorian cuisine in phx and probably last .

I love love love Gigi's cupcakes! I don't know what everyone is talking about when they say the cupcakes are bland; I go in on Fridays specifically to get the salted caramel because it's literally to die for. I only gave it four stars because the frosting is a little over-whelming, but no complaints about the taste

Fantastic! I can't say enough good things about my experience.  I spoke with Edgar on Thursday evening about replacing a hot water heater and he was able to come out today to replace it.  His quote was several hundred dollars less than others especially since I live on the second floor.  I had a new water heater, up to code now, in about an hour and hot water with in 30 minutes of installation.  I will definitely be calling again for future plumbing needs.

Fix has a very casual feel but it a higher end restaurant.  The restaurant is not enclosed and you can see out into the casino which was nice.  The food was pretty pricey but good.   I got the surf and turf and it was delicious.   As in any hotel the drinks were pretty pricey.  If you just want a relaxing place to eat good food (very casual, no need for dressy attire), Fix is the place for you.

We went to the restaurant on a weekday and it was pretty busy.  There was a half hour wait which isn't a big deal since it is Vegas.  Plenty was places to go while waiting.  I would say the food was pretty good.  I ordered the short ribs which was very tender.   We also got the oysters which are also good.  The only turn off was that I felt that the service was not that great compared to other restaurants.  I felt that the host was very rude, did not have a smile and always had an angry look on their face.   The servers were ok but nothing special.  I probably will not be back as part of the experience of Vegas is their service.

I came here due to some friends recommendation due to the reviews.  The restaurant is very plain looking, looks like an average diner.  After looking at the reviews, I decided to go with the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken.  The portions are crazy.  It is definitely a place to go eat if you are hungry.  I would say that the food was ok.  The price seems kind of expensive for what it is, but i guess the portions make up for it.  It seems that they just pile up a bunch of good together without thinking if it actually works.

Mom and Pop shop. Not a ton of flavors to choose from, but they seem to rotate the less popular ones to keep variety. Lots of fresh toppings to choose from. Friendly staff

5 Star for cleanliness, good pricing, and bright atmosphere.

Best Diner in Vegas. Large portions, great food, and super friendly staff. I finally got tired of being dissapointed with Ihop every 2 months or so when I need an all-out breakfast. So glad I found this place!

Unreal. Super tasty and the server was very helpful and polite. I had the garlic chik'n sandwich with avocado, very filling and full of flavor. I will absolutely be back to this place, parking is easy to find as well!

At first it doesn't look like much from the outside. Inside its clean, smells like a homemade burger shop and has a calm and relaxed atmosphere. Ordering for my big family was enjoyable, staff was patient, kind and attentive. Obviously ran by a family, father cooking and boys helping with everything else, that's something you don't see anymore, very cool! It took about 15 minutes for all the food to be ready, which was not bad timing for the size of my order. Everything was cooked to order and nothing was under, or over cooked. Food was hot fresh and delicious! We will be coming back and recommending it to all our friends.

Great food great service great atmosphere, you can't ask for more, except maybe seeing an elephant walking down the street with green rice fields and mountains in the background. Definitely suggest trying this place.

Stripsteak is a delightful surprise! My best friend and I were in Las Vegas for my birthday extravaganza and haphazardly stumbled upon Stripsteak after watching a show. We had no reservation, but were immediately seated. 

The food here is amazing! We shared the Shellfish Platter and the dry aged bone-in rib eye. We were also treated to their trio flavored fries, which were simply to die for!! 

Servers were friendly and attentive. The general decor of the place is pleasing and welcoming. Definitely a nice place to have dinner in Vegas.

This is my favorite Mediterranean restaurant. Tucked away in the corner of a shopping center it is a world away. Staff is always great with great service. Their gyros are simply the best. Always fresh, it is just what the doctor ordered. Due yourself a favor and don't miss this place.
Yummy tacos! Made right then and there. Small place but it was OK because it wasn't during the busy times.
Great service and food. Good portions. The sashimi is fresh and sushi was tasty. Clean restaurant. I enjoyed it better than MiNe. The spring rolls were fresh; I think they were hand made.

I have been here a couple times before. I brought some friends with me and was sorely dissappointed. The ice cream and waffle cone were good but don't come when they are busy. Staff aren't able to handle the flow of guests. My group of 4 was waiting 45 min and a party of 5 before us waited even longer. They sat 2 groups ahead of us who came in later. The two groups where also a party of 5 and 4. Which didn't make sense as those two groups that were seated had come in after us to get seats.  When we went to complain, I noticed my name crossed out and no one had called for my party. I was standing in front of the cake display, so I would have heard my name being called. The server said some guy used my name and gave a lukewarm apology. It was odd because our party was made up of asians and the party before us that was still waiting was made up of a visible minority(black and asian group). The two groups that got seated ahead of us were Caucasian. What does this tell me about their service?
Fun atmosphere, good food. Liked all the meat and delicious side dishes. I'd come back. Very limited parking though.
Yummy and unique flavors! Would visit again. Urban island ambiance, quite a few places to sit down and chat. Love the music.

This place so disgusting floors never mopped cups thrown everywhere some days filter never changed one of the workers is constantly high its terrible I shouldn't have to travel further down to a circle k when this one is right next to my house
Let me sum it up: Food is horrible, mac and cheese was runny, poor service , got a medium mac and cheese I opened it it was basically a small.

The food here was really amazing and why I'm giving 5 stars. Best chicken tikka masala I've ever had and the garlic naan is to die for. They also have a mango ice cream that is really delicious. Malbec on their wine list was really good and the owner/host is a bit loud but we found him entertaining and part of the experience. Food portions were a little small. They really need to modernize the receipt. Hand written and hard to understand
Great experience. The doctors and staff were very friendly and helpful. Great results as well. Would highly recommend

Went to Citizen for my 4th time and was very impressed. This place has an excellent ambience, good service, and very good drinks and wine. I've had the scallops, meatloaf, short ribs, and chopped salad. Each were amazing and perfectly prepared. This place does not disappoint

Some of the best ahi poke I've ever had. The corn chowder was amazing. Service was excellent, very modern sleek vibe, reasonably priced with a 4 course prix fixed menu at $70, and the chef even came out to greet us. Make sure to ask for extra caramels with the check. They will blow your mind
I have been going to Vern's for over 5 years now and the service we get is great and the owner is very friendly. Easy location to get to. Very clean establishment. Good prices on ice and water.

Went to Casey Moore for dinner before a show at the ASU Gammage. Walked into the place and was told by the bartender to seat ourselves. I asked if we could sit inside because it was quite cool outside and it looked like some people were smoking which I thought was against the law. Well anyway we sat down inside and waited to be greeted by a server and no one showed up after waiting about ten minutes and got up to try and get the bartender attention to no avail. So after waiting about a total of 15 minutes we walked out. Needless to say, their service was non-existence on this visit. Also no one asked how every thing was.
Glad to see dogs not allowed. A lot of people have allergies to dogs or are afraid of them. Service dogs are okay

Here is an HONEST, GENUINE place to take your car! The guys there are stand up guys all the way. Took my car there recently for what I thought would be rear brakes. As it turned out after inspecting my car, I needed a new master cylinder. They replaced it, completed the job in just a couple of hours and I had my car back. I have been to many places in the past that would have done the brakes too. And I would have spent more $$$ to get them replaced, because I didn't know any better. And they would have gladly taken me for it too. These guys showed me a brand new set of brakes to compare them with the ones on my car so I could see that there was not much wear on them and they would be just fine. Can't recall any other time I have EVER been in any kind of a car repair place that didn't try to stick it to you each and every time they had a chance. I really appreciated the way these guys took care of me. Will definitely bring my cars back there as needed for service and repair. I highly recommend Just Brakes! And by the way... they also had the best prices on brake services too which is why I was there in the first place.

Took my Jetta in for repairs... I had a feeling it was some sort of computer/electrical issue. Had read many threads online about this particular issue being a nightmare to pin point and fix. Which can also lead to it being very expensive.  Desert Oasis got the job done right. There was a sensor that was bad. AND, it was NOT expensive. In fact it was way less than I had expected it to be! Their customer service is fantastic, the work was preformed very fast and I got my car back and it is running better than ever! I am a very happy customer. I will also be back next time I have any problems with my car. The best part? I didn't have to go to the Stealership! I would much rather do business with a local family owned small business!

I first starting seeing Dr. Eaton a few years ago. My first visit, it was all I could do to get in the office I was in such bad shape. I had many injuries over the years and never really healed from them properly. I was in constant pain. I hobbled around like I was 150 years old. I did not want to rely on prescription meds to ease my pain. So I went to Community Chiropractic. I left that first day feeling better than I had felt in years. But due to my many years of neglecting my body, I needed much more attention than you can get in one visit. Dr Eaton worked with me and helped me understand what I needed to do to get  the best response from my body. He also showed me ways to make my body stronger in my problem/injured areas so I could be in less pain. Getting stronger has enabled me to a better quality of life with a lot less pain and aggravation. I once thought I was doomed to a life of pain. So glad things have turned around for me. I credit much of that to Dr Eaton. My visits now are much less frequent then they once were also. Just another sign that what Dr Eaton does WORKS!
From the moment you walk into the office, you know you're in a place that truly cares. Maryanne always greets you with a cheery welcome and makes you feel like you're with people that care about you. Because they do! Usually not much of a wait before Dr Eaton has you in a treatment room.  Once inside his hands on approach will have you feeling better in no time. He is always kind and caring. Very thorough and..... he's the best! It is really the only way I can describe my visits. Maryanne and Spencer are wonderful people! I can't say enough!  Another thing I really like/love about them.... even though we're all here in the big city, they give you that small town community feel. Community Chiropractic is the BEST! If I lived closer I'd stop by everyday just to say hello to them... they are wonderful people!
Five of us ordered food with apps and everything came out cold. Every single dish.  Scotch eggs are terrible when they're served cold.

I was in  Vegas a few weeks ago and I ordered from here twice. Everything was so great. One of the best salads I have had from a pizza joint anywhere. The delivery driver was so sweet. When I am in Vegas again this will always be my go to pizza place.
Really impressed with the hotel.. will be going back..I expected seedy because it is on Freak Street but it is actually really nice..

Thieves. I had to make a quick stop into Vegas to see my sick mom and I rented this car as part of a package deal with my flight. The gal at the counter didn't seem like she even wanted to be there. She didn't fully explain a damn thing to me and I was in such a rush. I said yes to pre-paid gas and even though the receipt said ESTIMATED CHARGES don't buy that BS. I brought the car back FULL and I was still charged $70. I did call their customer service and got my money back but think about the folks who don't. She said you should have told the person who checked the car back in. Umm i did and he said there was nothing he could do. And did I mention what a hunk of junk the car was? It was a new Chrysler  200 and it was so dirty inside. Dusty, funk on all over the carpet and the dings and scratches on the outside. OMG. I understand the name of the car rental company is thrifty but damn have a little pride. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! You have been warned!

I had the New  York strip and hands down it was one of the best steaks I ever had. We were there with a party of 6 and the only downside to the meal was you have to buy all the sides separate which can add up big time. I purchased my steak and 3 sides for the table and a drink and after tip, (which they add on) my tab was $99.  I don't mind paying good money for a meal but come on can we at least get a side with our steak or some bread?
Great concept but the actual doughnut is not very good. Maybe I went on a bad day or the other locations are better. I don't know but I was very disappointed...sorry
Had a subwoofer and amp installed in my 2017 Rav 4 . Shaun took his time and did a great job. Everything looks and sounds fantastic. His rates are very reasonable. I highly recommend Cinemagic.

We just got back from spending two hours in this amazing restaurant.  The service, food, handling of reservations everything was perfect.  Nothing packaged or cardborad like at this joint. the deserts were like home made and the specials ( i had the duck with bread pudding) ( my spouse had the scallops) were cooked to perfection.  I have lived in the surprise area for 14 years and this restaurant has been here for 8.  The first time that i have been there.  they treated us like long lost relatives  who just came over for super.  Job well done surprise needs a place like this on the Surprise Menu.

Hands down best trainer you'll find at the best price! He's personally invested in each of his clients, reliable, and really knows his stuff. I've done mountainside, orange theory and another trainer before I finally found B Lifted two years ago and I have no intentions of ever leaving. Even two years later, I still do new workouts every day! I love it!

If this was a inexpensive egg joint I wouldn't even bother with a review, but ...We went for a late breakfast/early lunch. Bacon and eggs was $20+ and toast was extra. Poached eggs came out like hard boiled eggs. Poke appetizer was mostly cucumber. Food was WAY overpriced and not very well prepared. The Cobb salad was good. Service was just okay...nothing special, just doing his job.

Awesome awesome awesome!!!!! Joey and his crew were on time, friendly,  and food was outstanding. We had sautéed pasta bar with steak, and the wood fired pizza display. I cannot begin to say what an amazing job they did I did not have to worry about a thing. I highly joeys wood fired pizza.

After damaging my tempered glass I came here. I was very pleased with the Manager Alex! He was friendly and fixed my phone in a timely manner. There were no bubbles or smudges when he applied my new tempered glass.  I would recommend this mobile repair shop to everyone. Definitely coming back again.

Amazing dinner! Must visit in Scottsdale. Ask to be seated at Jake's table he was the best. Fish tacos are phenom- and pumpkin bread pudding hit the spot. The Mission fries were slightly overbooked but still good. You won't be disappointed!
Walked in over my lunch hour and there was no wait. Was in and out in 30 minutes. Peri gave me a great haircut. Highly recommend Floyd's

I would like to say that I really like the concept, location, and setup of the restaurant. The only downside is the lackadaisical attitude of the staff. The management needs to train their staff in general hospitality and service. 

We went on a weekday evening and wanted to grab a bite to eat before we saw a movie at the AMC theater. When we arrived we were promptly seated and the restaurant was about 1/4 full. We placed our food order along with a flight of pinot noir. We had asked that the pinot flight come with the food. So far the service had been good. When the food got delivered it started to go downhill. 

We ordered a flatbread and a burger. Once the food was delivered we waited for the wine. I flagged the server down and asked for mustard for my burger and reminded her of the wine order. We got done with about half of our food when I got up and once again asked for the wine. This was annoying since the restaurant was not busy and had plenty of wait staff sitting around. A different server brought us our wine flight and excused the tardiness because they had just gotten a lot of drink orders for a large party that had just arrived. This seemed an absurd excuse since we had ordered our drinks about 20 minutes before that party arrived. After the wine arrived we were left unattended for a long while to the point that I had to ask for the check three times to two different people. Finally, I had to go to the bar to pay my bill. 

In conclusion, the service was appalling, the food was mediocre, and the wine list is all of young vintages. My wife and I  will not be going back.
This place is typically busy. There are exactly four tables, so it is difficult to find seats at times. The food was great! I would recommend the tacos especially. There is a great beer selection.

Ariyoshi vs. Pacific East

Be mindful that for my Japanese food, I only care about tempura and rolls.

Atmosphere:  TIE
Pacific East is much smaller and more cramped. Their furniture is old, bordering wobbly. It was almost full when I went.
Ariyoshi is much larger, but it was almost empty the two times I went. The extremely good waiter to customer ratio is haunted by awkward silence. You also save couple quarters, since you pay the meters to go to Pacific East.

Tempura: TIE
While I enjoy tempura, I don't think I'm good enough to differentiate the subtleties. Both restaurants gave similar portion of crispy tempuras, coupled with the delicious sauce that I can't identify.

Rolls: Ariyoshi

It's been several months since I went to Pacific East, but I remember not being impressed; it was whatever. Then I tried Thai rolls in Ariyoshi, and DAMN they were awesome. I tried two other rolls there as well, and they were great. But the Thai rolls! THAI ROLLS!

Bottom line: 
If you are fan of rolls, go try the Thai rolls.
If you haven't had too much exposure to Japanese food, try my favorite dinner: mixed tempura for appetizer and Thai rolls for entree. Order Sapporo if you like beer.
loved the beer sampler - 4 for 10 dollars. I really liked head hunter rye. Also loved duck breast.  portion is small but it was juicy.

Grumpy's was a-okay.

Sunday around 11 AM. About an hour wait; but we had a party of 9. Decor was okay I guess, not meticulous about that myself. Our table was not wobbly though.

Ordered the grumpy's special, w/ a choice of meat (sausage for me), egg (sunny side up), home fries, and pumpkin pancakes, all for $7.99.

Nothing special. Just any other continental breakfast you can have from any other places. Pumpkin pancakes don't taste all that special or delicious.

Had duck choo chi and country pad thai on a Friday afternoon. The food came out literally in five minutes. The duck meat was really well cooked. Country pad thai is similar to a regular rendition, but it was a refreshing change.

Upon reservation the restaurant accommodated us promptly. the waiter was merchant-like, encouraging us to order wine and desert; I personally prefer waiters to only intervene when prompted. LOLA has an ipad as the drinks menu; fancy fancy. i ordered this plum-flavored belgian beer that turned out to be $8 wood chuck. note to self: always try wine at a three dollar sign restaurant.

as advertised, beef pierogi was awesome. it has many different flavor in ways that you don't experience everyday. it is "the difference" you expect when you commit yourself (financially) for a fine dining. For entree, I tried the two pork dish: pork chop and the quail & pork belly. Pork chop doesn't have too many different flavors; it's mostly the pork chop and grits, but the flavor is very rich; it's one of those things you just describe as "damn good." For me personally, it wasn't quiet the "blew me away" fine dining entree i hoped it would be. Pork belly was okay, while the quail was a bit salty but very flavorful; the side vegetables had refreshing and sour flavor and turned out to be my favorite part about this dish.

overall, i really liked beef pierogi, but was not blown away by the pork dish. between the two pork dish, i'd recommend the pork chop. and i wish i never ordered the $8 wood chuck.

We live in Prescott and called Bulwark  yesterday to set up a home visit.  We were happy that we were able to get a tech here this morning.  Mike Jones arrived on time, actually he was at our home a few minutes ahead of schedule.  Mike asked what was going on.  He checked all around our home and we discussed what the game plan was.  Mike went over the products he would be using and explained Bulwark only uses top quality products that are safe around pets and children.  This is good, as we have two 10 month old puppies who love to explore and we would not allow any hazardous chemicals in or around our home.  This is our first experience using a pest control company and so far we are very pleased with Bulwark.  Our tech, Mike was informative, polite, professional and we feel confident that he will take care of our needs.

We were looking for well made furniture in near perfect condition for a rental home.  After shopping quite a few furniture stores we were referred to Lynne's by another consignment shop who did not have what we were looking for.  We found exactly what we were looking for.  Marty, who went out of her way to help us furnish the entire house.  Marty's interior design background was a big plus for us as we searched for  accessories to complement our purchase.  We were introduced to Tom, the owner,  who offered his expertise.  Everyone at Lynne's were very upbeat and professional including the gal at the front desk and the warehouse guys who packed the  furniture in our trailer...it took 3 trips to get everything home...We enjoyed our shopping experience and will definitely return.

Been seeing Dr A rn for almost 25 years and wouldn't trust my pointers health well being to any other vet.  Dr. Arn and his staff have taken care of my 6 pointers and we just love him.  He very much cares for our pets and doesn't try to add any additional tests when not necessary.  I now live in AZ and travel 150 miles to have my pointer twins taken care of by Dr. Arn

Very good ramen. I had the Morris- Chashu Pork Belly, Ajitama, (marinated egg), Menma (fermented bamboo shoots), which I was very satisfied with. The pork broth was thick and full of flavor, the noodles were great (we saw them massaging them before cooking!), the bamboo shoots added an interesting texture to the dish, and the best was the marinated egg. The egg was probably the most perfect ajitama I've had. It was marinated to just the right amount of saltiness and flavor, and the egg yolk was like a translucent custard. I was savoring each bite of the egg. 

It is easy to miss the entrance as I didn't see a huge sign board. It was dark and cozy inside, kind of had a hipsterish vibe. Good service too.

Love this place. I always come out happy. My favorite flavors are the Original (Tart) and Taro. Their bubble tea and Bingsu (shaved ice) is quite nice too. They are pretty generous with the fruits on their Bingsu but I do wish they would put more shaved ice into it.

I'm a fan of Julep, it is my favorite restaurant in Madison at the moment. After dinner there with a friend, I was quick to recommend it to my friends and coworkers. The fried chicken is very good. Crispy, tasty skin, with flavorful, moist thigh boneless meat- this combination is hard to come by. The shrimp and grits were delicious too- large shrimp cooked just right, and the grits were creamy and well-seasoned. I wasn't a big fan of the peppers in this dish, but it didn't detract from the dish. The shrimp fritters were unexpected, I was expecting whole shrimp but it was more like a shrimp paste.. I enjoyed it though, as well as the okra that came with this appetizer. My friend had a few cocktails and was happy with the quality of them. I also appreciated the ambience and decor of the restaurant.. the salt and pepper shakers are adorable and what an interesting idea to hang the antique headboard on the wall. Overall, Julep gets 5 stars because the service, ambience, decor, food, drinks, and location are all very good.

The food is good, but not the best fried chicken I've had. They also have spit fire roasted chicken but who gets that when you can have fried chicken? :p I like their variety of dipping sauces and side dishes. The flight of slushies is recommended- it is a fun novelty. Their fried pork rinds and gravy fries are very good! I didn't like the fried green tomatoes, the batter and tomatoes were too thick. Watson's can get pretty crowded and noisy on Friday/Saturday nights.

Bad customer service! I had a query regarding rekeying the locks in my house and the person was so rude. When I asked questions regarding the process (I just wanted to understand what they were going to do) and confirming the pricing, he started to get agitated and act like I was a huge pain in the a**. Definitely taking my locks and money elsewhere.

Update- If I could change this to 3.5 stars, I would. Went back and had the cheese curds again and enjoyed it. I also had their walleye sandwich and was happy with it. A tastier dining experience compared to my first visit. Their onion string fries are quite good too.

Horrible experience. It took our table 2 hours to order, get our food and pay. My two tacos were oily and nothing to rave about. They even messed up my order, leaving out a side dish and charging for it. My water was never refilled.

Pork belly done right! It is really difficult to find good pork belly, it is either too fat or too lean, too hard or too soft...but Umami's comes very close to my idea of pork belly perfection. I had the pork bun, meal ($4) which came with 2 slices of pork belly in a bun, and a side of endamame (there's the option of getting the wonton skin crisps as a side). The bun is very good too, soft and fluffy. The portion is small, more of a snack size.  I found them at the intersection of Main and Martin Luther King Jr on Saturday at the Farmers market. Highly recommended for a snack (you'd probably need 4 or 5 for a full meal).

I've been twice, but I'm still not a big fan of the library. The cheese curds and fried pickles are pretty good, but my main dishes have always left me feeling like I could get a better meal elsewhere for the price. Maybe it is because I ordered salads on both visits, and the salads just seemed "thrown together".
The baby goats are cute, and the hazelnut goat's milk gelato is such a treat. It is pricey, but definitely worth it when I feel like indulging in something other than a $0.69 McD vanilla cone.
This review is solely for the vanilla cone. Happiness you can buy with less than 3 quarters! Never disappoints. And it gets even better when you dip your fries into it :P

I've had this same sandwich (my fav- special combo with everything) 3 lunches in a row and didn't feel tired of it at all.. it is that good. Sometimes, I wonder how a sandwich that simple can taste so good! The combo special has roast pork and steamed pork roll. I also recommend including pate in the sandwich. Very friendly customer service too, and the speed they make these sandwiches is crazy fast.

This is a really amazing foodcart on State Street. I've had two dishes here and they were delicious. The papaya salad with chicken and sticky rice was tangy and refreshing. I had mine with BBQ pork because they had not enough chicken remaining, and actually prefer it that way. They also have these giant avocado spring rolls (see photo for scale!) for only $3.00!! Perfect, healthy, cheap lunch on a summer's day. You can also add meat to the spring rolls for the same price! A tip though- their food can be really spicy. I am quite tolerant of spicy (hot) food, but even their mild was too hot for me in the papaya salad. Their customer service is excellent. The guy and lady are so cheerful and friendly, it is like they really enjoy what they do and their customers. Once when they ran out of a dish I wanted, they gave suggestions, and even samples to help me choose another dish.
Good food. Had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Mutton Madras Curry, and enjoyed both dishes. Looking forward to my next visit already!

This year's festival (2017) was utterly ridiculous and disappointing. Whose stupid idea was it to require the purchase of a $6.00 EMPTY plastic cup for alcohol consumption in the festival area? That means having one drink will cost at least $10 ($6 for the empty cup, $4 for a bud light). What a joke! Also the people manning the "official" beer stands had no idea about the types of beer they were serving and the people manning the ticket sales gave wrong info to my friend. Sweet corn was meh and super messy to eat. They ran out of napkins. Fortunately, I went with good company, and had fun despite the not-fun-festival.

Highly recommended. I seldom order chicken when eating out because it almost never meets my expectations but I've had their Jerk Chicken meal multiple times- that says a lot! Very tender, moist, and flavorful chicken, and a generous portion too. Makes me hungry just typing this. I always get it with the steamed cabbage as a side. And the plantains are delicious! Service is fast, friendly, and efficient too, great place to grab a quick lunch. Too bad I don't have photos of the deliciousness, will add some when I next have them.

I've been to Kabul twice- once for lunch and once for dinner. I was happier after the lunch as I felt like the lunch menu pricing corresponded better to the quality of the dishes. I had the Sambosa appetizer (very good), Lamb Curry (good taste, but would have liked it more tender), and Burani (ok). My friend had the kabobs and was quite happy with it. My favorite part of the meal was the bread that came with an amazing green chutney sauce.

I just came here for the pastries and they were good. They had about 7 different items in the case, and it was hard to choose because they all looked yummy! The interior of Sophia's is very small and it can be a challenge to it get in someone's way. Seating is very limited too, a suggestion would be to get your treats and go to James Madison park to enjoy them :) I didn't try any dishes, but I saw someone's pancakes which had more blueberries than batter.. yums! This place is cash only.

My family has been coming here for the great value for years. We live equally in between the scottsdale locations, but we always pick this one for the customer service. Tim, is so friendly and eager to assist my family. HE remembers my orders from months ago and we really appreciate his efforts. The rest of the staff is also gracious and even previous staff were always friendly and if we had a lunch buffet request would try to accommodate us. The food is consistent and reasonably priced.

MY husband loves karaoke and so we often find ourselves here with friends and loved one's. The drinks are cheap, the staff is friendly and the food has gotten much better over the last couple of months. We used to just order drinks while we hung out here, but since the fall we have started trying different menu items and the  sandwiches are tastier and the crab is so much better than it used to be!

Great customer service at this location. Cliff in the cafe is so great and super friendly. We shop here all the time and he knows what we are going  to order as soon as he sees us. He just goes above and beyond for the guests. Also, had several issues with online ordering and the staff at customer service has always been so helpful in resolving these issues.

Customer service is paramount to me, and this car wash has always met my expectations. One time I had an issue late on a saturday night and the owner provides his phone number in case of an issue; I called him, he answered, troubleshooted the issue for me, and said if that didn't fix the problem he would come down to resolve the problem. I was appreciative and my family actually lives closer to another car wash, but we always patronize this car wash because the owner clearly values all of his customers. They take cards, not just cash, and the facility is always clean and the machines work well.

Love this place. My family has been going here for fresh and delicious mexican food since 2000. More important than the great food, is the customer service. David always provides great customer service and is so welcoming to every customer. They know my order as soon as they see me coming in the door. I love the chicken fajitas and the taco's can't be beat! If it was closer to where we lived I would be here every week chowing down on the great salsa and chips!

Love it Love it Love it.
Mostly i love their amazing customer service.  I had to rent a van for my church charity event but i forgot to cancel when the event got cancelled.  Even though they don't need to reimburse me the money according to the policy, they kindly gave me a full refund.  I've never seen this kind of gesture by any other company.  They deserve 5 stars.

This is quick Italian food delivered Chipotle-style, which seems to be a trend these days. I'll give extra points for service, cleanliness, novelty, large serving portions, value for money, and environment/decor. The food itself is average but worth my while for a quick take out order if I wasn't in the mood to prepare dinner. This all boils down to 4-stars overall.

I had the lemon-crusted cod on risotto. There are things about restaurant fish that I look for, and this dish hit all the right marks. First off, the skin and crust was crispy and well-seared. The meat was flaky, well cooked, yet moist and tender. The infusion of citrus and the way it was seasoned did not overpower. It tasted as if it was caught that day and did not taste "fishy". The risotto provided a good balance.

My dinner date had the rib-eye, which I tasted. The things I look for: they had the done-ness right and it was tender. Red and Moxie are the only places that get the done-ness correct 100% of the time (The reason why I'm a regular at Red). These had bacon fingerling potatoes and spiced green beans on the side. The whole combination worked and made for an interesting mix of flavors.

I'm coming back.

Awesome service. Awesome sauce (for the strips). Everyone was polite and friendly.

And that chicken, to die for... or to cluck for... or... never mind.

Kohl's has the best-looking, brightest, most spacious, and cleanest...

...bathrooms out of all department stores out there.

The whole store is the same way. I love Kohl's for great deals on clothes and accessories. With Kohl's cash in hand and coupons, my budget can be stretched further here. I love the little surprise finds too in the watch & jewelry section, as well as from the kitchen & appliance sections.
This a small-sized lounge with your standard business center, lounge chairs, dinning tables and bar. No shower. Small bathroom. Pretty standard. I love the colors.

"Dad, what's a vinyl record?"

"Well son, um, it's a, um, never mind, let me take you to The Loop."

Then it got me talking about other things I grew up with: rotary phones, writing a letter, talking to friends and actually playing outside.

As I child, I'd also remember grandpa having a massive vinyl collection and he'd smoke his pipe, yes, a pipe, and play some jazz records every Sunday morning. Good times.

And oh, my review? Yeah, the coffee here is great by the way. It's the kind of place with seriously good lattes with the bonus of coffee art on it - I love it when they do that.

So yeah, 5 stars.

Updated review: 
 Another visit to Big B's and another amazing dinner. 
Place just keeps getting better and that's hard to do with how perfect the bbq is and don't forget some of the best sides you'll ever have in your life.  



Previous review : 
This place is sooooo amazing. Absolutely the best BBQ in The Valley vegas or Henderson.  Can't be beat!

The food is excellent, the staff is friendly, everything is just top notch. 

I have started eating here at least once a week and I love it.

Great times to be had here.  Awesome view of the golden knights hockey game.  

Thank you to Chad, Kelly, and Stephanie.   

Thank you all so much.

Apparently they close whenever they feel like it. Like at 830 in the morning refusing to serve selected people and discriminating against people in line.  While serving other people 

I will never return here or to this target as long as the staff is allowed to treat people like that.
This jack in the box is far above the others in the area.  Food is always fresh.  Staff is helpful and polite and they do a very good job.

Very slow.  Pharmacists are nice and knowledgable. But the store staff is seriously lacking in people skills and prescriptions are not ready when promised.  

Most of the time there is no one at the cashier.  I'd go somewhere else if there was a pharmacy anywhere near by.

Late night they always tell you they can only take cash because "their credit card systems are down" every night. And can't provide receipts.  But the real truth is that the cashiers are pocketing the cash and the managers are in on it.

Had lunch here yesterday.  The restaurant has an authentic noodle shop environment. The food was great and my bartender / server (Jenna) was AMAZING. 

*****

Such a great place and wonderful service.  Will definitely be back.

I used to work there( kitchen) and I can say that this is the cleanest place in vegas always fresh food and good variety in the menu and beside I had my differences with Dean (the owner which is a really good person and cares about the customers) I would totally recommend this place to everybody. They have Happy hour and all you can eat menu believe me you wont regret it. Good luck Dean att. JC
Best tacos I ever tried (al pastor) just make sure to be patient with your food because this place is always full. I just wish you guys will add tortas to the menu but i love this place
Best place ever nobody can beat their prices. Exelent customer service thank you Virginia Zamora

The BEST Hot-Sour Soup in the USA, Hands Down !!!! Fast Service. This is a must stop on the strip. Hard to find inside the Venetian. Look for the sports book. Lettuce wraps are fresh and hot. Very Clean Restaurant !!! Try everything on this menu. Jazmin Tea is awesome.....Excellent for late night dining

Hostess was Beautiful...No waiting. Place was almost empty at 1230pm. Very Disappointing dining experience. Waiter was not friendly or knowledgeable of the menu. Burger was thin and very dry. Onions had no flavor. Caesar Salad had very little flavor and lettuce seemed old. Waiter was shocked when I asked if I could sample some of the sauce restaurant sells on shelves, as if no sample was available. I asked for Tabasco sauce to add some flavor to my very dry burger, none arrived. Too Bad this restaurant was below expectations as I am an avid fan of Guy's TV show. Save your money, this place is expensive...There are better places to eat within walking distance to this place.....

I've heard that Lo-Lo's was the best chicken and waffles around and this place totally lived up to all the talk. Waited to get seated for 40 minutes but it was worth the wait. They were super busy but the servers were very attentive and friendly. As for the food, the chicken was packed with flavor along with being juicy. I didn't want to stop eating. I would definitely come back.
My husband and I we looking for a different restaurant and saw this place and decided to give it a try. The service was GREAT. Our server was very attentive and fast.

We came here because I wanted to try something different. This place had very good reviews on Yelp so I thought I would give it a try and I'm glad I did. Bobby Q had really great food, service and an all around great experience.
I was from out of town and needed firewood for a camping trip. Jenn and Richard were courteous and extremely helpful. They helped make my trip a huge success. Good company and great people!

Five stars again. These guys are simply the BEST!!!! I would never refer my clients anywhere else. They have treated my clients items like they were museum artifacts.... Carefully bubble wrapping, shrink wrapping, rolling out the red carpet and taking such care when loading and unloading. I cannot say enough good things about Muscular Moving men!!!!
Just are here and the menu is good and the service was outstanding !! The waitress even brought us extra home fries for free !! The account was working a little to we'll was my only complaint
It's very low grade sharama's and restaurant!prices seemed ok but I won't be back because u don't even get to watch or see what topping or sauces they put on ! SCARRY!!

just got steak with shrimp and crab on top with a lobster butter over it and masha on side ! it was a mess ! the wife had seafood pasta and noodles were over cooked ! No bread with meals and nothing complimentary!! won't be back they can't beat the keg ! I know why u get in fast here because the portions r tiny also
